Restaurants:
Near the house, I love La Loteria and on Seventh Avenue and Bedford for "new Mexican" food; Rafele for Italian including the great fritto misto and caponata, excellent house made pastas. Fifty at 50 Commerce for "new American". Taco Mahal on Seventh Ave just south of Bleecker, east side of street – Indian inspired tacos and basmati rice bowl

Bob White Counter – just south of Taco Mahal – small sit down restaurant that does take out. $13 fried chicken or fried catfish with a side of NY’s best mac & cheese; artisanal liquor at the bar; cheap happy hour

Masala Times – Bleecker just east of Sixth Ave – sit down or take out, excellent lamb biryani, full of Indian NYU students

description:
Where's better but the historic West Village of Manhattan? Write a book, a thesis, a filmscript here... you wouldn't be the first! Or just relax - yes, relax - in this NYC gem.

The space
Private Loft-Style home with 16 foot ceilings sun-drenched from a skylight. Queen Loft bed and extra guest Queen pullout for office. Working fireplace. Wood interior. Washer/Dryer. Deep bathtub. Charming as any NYC apt can be, from the late 1800's. Overlooking a quaint park. Cozy and clean, safe and quiet, it offers everything you need.

4th Floor walk-up. The apartment is on the top floor, with quiet and respectful neighbors. Most apartments in the area are low-ceiling and much less light. A true home experience in NYC.

Chelsea Piers, Highline, SoHo, Union Square are nearby.

neighborhood_description:
Downtown Jersey City is quite safe, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 10 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken, the birthplace of Frank Sinatra and the Cake Boss, Liberty Science Center, and Liberty State Park. Liberty State Park has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan, not to mention great views. And of course, you are very close to Manhattan.

neighborhood_description:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. neighborhood_description:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park

neighborhood_description:

PLS BE CONSIDERATE! Your request blocks my calendar. DO NOT REQUEST! Find the "contact host" button by scrolling down for 5+ NIGHTS. Shorter I offer 2-3 wks out, 1 night I only do a day ahead.

Walk one flight up to the parlor apartment, which looks out on Jones Street. Soaring 12-foot ceilings create a spacious feeling; decor is shabby vintage and homey. Simple kitchen and bathroom but with everything you need to live like a New Yorker. Tall windows look out onto Jones Street.

The space
Hi there -- Want to book? FIRST -- Scroll way down to the "contact host" button so we can exchange info about my place and your Covid safety practices and just in general make sure it's a good fit. I don't offer a stay before having a (written) conversation, especially if you have no reviews. Do not request to book until you hear from me directly. AirB blocks my calendar if you request formally, and I may already have offered it to someone.
neighborhood_description: This is Greenwich Village!  The best neighborhood in NYC!

name: A Lovely 2br in Chelsea
description:
Clean, quiet 2br in the perfect location--A/C/E/L at one corner, Chelsea Market at the other, all the Chelsea art galleries a few blocks up, West Village a few blocks down, Meatpacking clubs a couple blocks West, 5 minute walk to the river, cafes everywhere; energy efficient air conditioners in both bedrooms, AppleTV with Netflix, HBO, Amazon, and all rooms have Homepods for music.

Guest access
The whole apartment will be yours.

Other things to note
My apartment is a fifth-floor walk up. The master bedroom has a queen bed and the second bedroom has a twin bed.

name: Safe townhouse suite, private bath, garden use
description:
For one adult person who's not keeping vampire hours. No pets. Your key leads up 1 flight to your own second-floor suite (bedroom, bath) in 5 story house occupied by 1 owner . A 15x15 foot private bedroom with ceiling fan; all tile private bath w ceiling rain shower, garden view. Twin bed; chaise longue, chair, desk, luggage & clothes racks, tea kettle, 400 mbps wifi. No guests of guests. You do not share living spaces with host except front door & stairs. Host fully vaccinated.

The space
Your room, hall and bath are the entire 2nd floor of this beautifully restored and decorated 1850s brick townhouse in the West Village. The house has been published in several decor magazines, including photos of this bedroom. The room is 15' by 15'. There's a single bed with all cotton linens and European down comforter, an elegant 19th century chaise longue covered with silk, a working woodburning fireplace, hundreds of books, a 42 inch TV + VCR.. everything you need to
neighborhood_description:
in the heart of the West Village (Greenwich Village) - the best restaurants, bars, movie theaters and shopping in New York, in my opinion! The immediate neighborhood has dozens of coffee shops, bars, and restaurants of every price level and description, as well as two art house cinemas (Film Form and IFC) and a Citibikes bike rental station. It is also near two major subway lines.

Due to the stairs it is not suitable for infirm or disabled persons. There are two cats in the house but they won't enter your room (they can't open the door!).



The West Village is a vibrant, fashionable, affluent neighborhood of townhouses and small apartment buildings with some of Manhattan's best dining and shopping. It is near the Hudson River Park and contains several parks including Washington Square Park.

name: Financial District Oasis, Bright Summer Room
description:
Whether you want to explore on foot the rich history of Wall Street or cruise by sea the Lady Liberty this shared 3 bedroom apartment provides sophisticated simplicity and value for a private room. This home is a shared space.

The space
You will be staying in a sun-drenched room in my charming apartment share - this elevator building makes the perfect base for your exploration of New York City, with 11 subway lines easily accessible from your doorstep. Located a couple blocks from Wall Street, steps away from the most amazing Financial District eats on charming Stone Street, the tranquil waterfront neighborhood of Battery Park and the World Trade Center are merely minutes away.

Here you can get all the comforts of home plus a new standard size bed in the private room, a fully equipped kitchen, a 47'' plasma TV in the living room and loaded gym and beautiful rustic rooftop for a fraction of the price.

Perfect for a pet friendly professional

Studio apt, impeccably appointed, perfect for 2 people. Location is ideal and near metro stops to go anywhere in NYC. The apartment is steps from chic restaurants and shopping. Only a few short blocks walking from the eponymous Century 21, World Trade Center, Locanda Verde and more . Doorman, elevator bldg with full size bath & kitchen.

name: Renovated Urban Oasis w/ private patio
description:
Newly renovated art-filled condo in prime downtown Hoboken location, not your standard AirBnB. Ours features soaring 14 foot ceilings, chef’s kitchen, private patio with grill and central AC/heat. Location is 2min walk to the NYC bus + 5min walk to the PATH train. Everything our charming city has to offer is at your doorstep — cafes, coffee shops restaurants. This is my primary + sole residence and I’d love to share it with guests who are looking for a relaxed stay away from home.

The space
This one of a kind property was lovingly redone this spring and includes soaring 14 foot ceilings with crown moldings, exposed brick wall, central AC and heat, full sized washer and dryer, chefs kitchen with dishwasher and a private deck with grill. Bedroom has a queen bed, ceiling fan and is connected to the central ac/heat system.

Guest access
You will have private access to the entire apartment during your stay — one bedroom, living/dining room,
neighborhood_description: Hoboken has been dubbed one of the most walkable cities in the country by (website hidden) in its 2014 ratings of Most Walkable U.S. Cities and Neighborhoods. Hoboken earned the highest so-called Walk Score in the country out of 2,978 cities rated by the website. Everything at your doorstep -- coffee shops, restaurants, our beautiful waterfront, a park for your dog, grocery stores...and 2min walk to the NYC bus or 5min walk to the subway

name: DWTN Jersey City Art Studio Apt, long term stays
description:
Art studio apt. in downtown Jersey City. Completely renovated with custom Murphy bed, radiant floor heating and A/C, gas cooktop, bathroom w/walk-in shower, and private street entrance. It is a 12-min. walk to PATH station; then two stops to World Trade Center (NYC) or 6 stops to mid-town NYC.

The space
This ground floor, studio apartment is in downtown Jersey City, where I live part of the year. You have one full-time neighbor upstairs. The building was originally built in 1885 but fully renovated in 2015. The apartment is a studio and has a water heater and water pump in the unit that run occasionally. You will occasionally hear the appliances as well as the upstairs guest footfall ... Ear plugs for sleeping are the simple solution if complete silence is needed.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire studio apartment and small backyard.

Other things to note
Parking is limited in Jersey City so I don't re
neighborhood_description:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - haven't been, but heard it's great. (12 min.)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Third and Vine - wine and cheese bar (3 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min.)
Taqueria - great fish, pork tacos (13 min.)
White Horse - fine dining,

name: Dr Norton House@Lincoln Park JC,NJ
description:
Private, large apt in Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. 1 mile to JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC! Hardwd flrs, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR, sofa in bedroom and living room (no sleeper sofa), TV, WiFi, laundry.

The space
1st flr apt of beautiful Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. We have installed brand new central A/C and heat system! Stunning hardwood floors have been redone, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR (1 queen, 1 full) , FIOS TV, WiFi cable, laundry. 1 mi from JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC!

This is a beautiful, comfortable space with all the amenities you may need. You can walk 50 yards to catch the NJ Transit #10 bus that brings you 1 mile to Journal Square where you can catch the PATH train to NYC, Hoboken or Newark, which connects you to NJ Transit trains to everywhere! You can also catch the #119 bus
neighborhood_description:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is

name: Historic Brownstone in Jersey City
description:
Private floor in a Victorian brownstone with 2 berms, bath and a kitchenette. Easy street parking or parking 1 block offsite at $10/day. In historic neighborhood; quick assess to Manhattan, NJ turnpike, EWR, Path train, MetLife Stadium.

The space
The accommodation consists of a very large and spacious double bedroom with a private bathroom and kitchenette for your sole use on the second floor of our newly restored brownstone in the historic West Side district of Jersey City.

The room has a queen size bed in an alcove, with a living area for working or relaxing. There is also a second bedroom on the same floor that is available for larger groups or families. Both rooms have original marble mantles with wood floors. The two rooms are joined together by a small, but fully equipped, kitchenette with gas hob, microwave and fridge. We never have more than one booking at any one time, so it will always be just your travelling party staying with us.

name: New York City in 5 minutes
description:
Sunny and gorgeous bedroom w/bathroom is 5 to 10 minutes away from New York City's Times Square. The spacious bedroom is located on the 2nd floor, queen size bed, 2 big windows, walk-in closet, 2 nightstands, a desk and wifi for your laptop. Private living room with smart TV and private bathroom. Very safe neighborhood and close to restaurants, grocery stores and transportation.

The space

name: Statue of Liberty Views Downtown
description:
Our alcove studio comfortably sleeps two and has breathtaking views of the Statue of Liberty and New York Harbor. It is on the water surrounded by parks, but also close to restaurants, shops, several tourist sites, buses, subways, and ferries.

The space
This apartment is on the 31st floor with south-facing exposure and full views of New York harbor and downtown Manhattan, including the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The apartment is very quiet and has a back entrance directly to the Hudson River. The neighborhood is very safe, well-lit and patrolled by the park police even at night, and is surrounded by public parts, a pedestrian walking path along the water, playgrounds, shops, restaurants, and a marina.

The apartment comes equipped with linens; a kitchen with dishes, pots and pans, and a dishwasher; a television; and free Wifi internet. The bed sleeps two adults. There is a 24 hour doorman at the building entrance, and an elevator.
neighborhood_description: The building has a back entrance directly onto the water, and is steps away from a lovely walkway along the water (the Esplanade), several parks and playgrounds, restaurants, the World Financial Center and shops.  Within a short walk there is a Whole Foods, a movie theater, drugstores, dry cleaners, and a number of other shops.  Wall Street and the ferries to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are within walking distance.  This neighborhood is also exceptionally well connected to public transport.

name: Spacious neo-country seaside loft
description:
A beautiful, spacious one-bedroom loft in the heart of Red Hook perfect for 1-2 people (3-4 with some combination of air mattress, hammock, or couch). Features exposed brick, lots of light, lots of art, family antiques, an incredible kitchen, a home theater and a yard with a grill.

The space
The place really is special. Not only is it spacious and comfortable and beautiful but I've taken great care to make it a home. To me that means that everything in it has special meaning and I think you'll get that sense immediately when you walk in.

The house only has four units so there's very limited traffic but the other people in the building are wonderful neighbors.

The kitchen is a joy to cook in. The island is perfect for hanging or working around. The dining room table is great for big meals and the living room is a cozy dream for musicphiles and film fanatics. I'm a filmmaker so creating such a space was important to me. I'm also a photograph
neighborhood_description: My place is smack in the middle of the best part of Red Hook and Red Hook is my favorite neighborhood in New York. There are super restaurants and cafes and bars all within a block or two or three. The best supermarket in New York (Fairway) is six blocks away, although now it has become Food Bazaar. You also have the oldest (and I think best) bar in New York in Sunny's just five blocks away. San Pedro, Fort Defiance, Hoek, Van Brunt Stillhouse, Hometown BBQ, and Brooklyn Crab are some of the other great spots. And then you're just a few blocks from the water which you can access at a couple different parks. A ferry (which is free on weekends) even takes you straight to Manhattan.

neighborhood_description:
While in Hudson County, weekly visits to Hoboken are the norm. A cultural Mecca, Hoboken is home to some of the country’s finest restaurants, (Hoboken Menus), bars, art galleries, entertainment venues, and parks.

Lined with acclaimed restaurants, chic bars, and eclectic shops, Washington Street is Hoboken’s main hub of activity. One of Washington Street’s most-renowned hotspots is Maxwell’s, a restaurant/club that offers some of the best music, food, and drinks in the Metropolitan area. For film buffs, the Hoboken International Film Festival is one of many festivals hosted in Hoboken. Whatever your fancy, Hoboken offers countless options for daytime and evening entertainment.

With its proximity and cultural similarity to New York City, Hudson County is sometimes called "New York’s sixth borough". While living in Hudson County, residents experience the best New Jersey has to offer, with the luxury of being only minutes from the city.

name: Unique NYC Loft - Guest Room
description:
The apartment is located downtown Manhattan, this renovated artist loft offers over 2,000 sq ft of chic living. Steps from Battery Park, Wall St, the Seaport, Tribeca and all major subways. The space offers a unique opportunity to live out your NYC dream vacation.

Some upfront rules:
Please be fully vaccinated.
This Airbnb is only for 2 guest.
Please do not have other people to the house. If you would like to show someone the art, or the Apartment please ask first.

The space
This is a true artist loft with 10 ft high ceilings and views of the East River, it is rustic and quaint. It is different as it does not have traditional doors, windows, etc which you would get in a modern building, but it is truly an experience. The room is large, private with a lush queen sized bed, large closet, computer, and dresser drawers.

This building was erected in the 1800’s and at the time, the neighborhood was a shipyard filled with large docks
neighborhood_description: The neighborhood is reminiscent of old-school Europe. In the early 1800s the area was a major port, and this building was used to be a warehouse for the storage of spices. All around there are cafes, pubs, and restaurants that line cobble stone streets, and the nearby park offers a refuge from the concrete jungle life. While there is a lot going on, the apartment is quiet, which is unusual for NYC.

Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

neighborhood_description:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte

description:
PROS
Conveniently located to access lower Manhattan and visit the Statute of Liberty
Suitable for people using Newark Airport, driving car, traveling in group or looking for basic accommodation

CONS
There is a construction of a tall apartment complex in a lot adjacent to our property and you may feel like staying in the middle of a construction site.
Not located in downtown Jersey City and very limited availability of stores/restaurants in the neighborhood.

The space
- Independent 2 bedroom house (780 sf)
- There are 2 houses on the premise -- one single-family and one two-family (+ basement) separated by deck
- The owner lives in one of the units

neighborhood_description:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

Relax and unwind in our comfortable, eclectic six room space after a day of sightseeing. This large apartment occupies the entire 1st floor of a 1910s era home in Jersey City's 'The Heights' neighborhood. The residential area is quiet and safe.

STR21-00050 9/19/2021

neighborhood_description:
"The Heights" is a diverse neighborhood in Jersey City. Local grocery, limited restaurant/deli and liquor stores are within a 5-20 minute walk. There are also two urban parks within close walking distance, Pershing Field and Gordon Park. Pershing field has playground equipment, tennis courts and other amenities.

Please note "the Heights" is not in the 'downtown' area of Jersey City that borders the Hudson River. The Heights is primarily a residential, rather than commercial, neighborhood. You can reach Jersey City's waterfront via 2 subway stops, Grove Street or Exchange Place or take a taxi there.

"New Yorkers of all designations—young, new, native and salty curmudgeon alike—are famously passionate in both their enthusiasms and their critiques. If they dislike a book, movie or restaurant, you'll know about it. But if they love it, they'll shout it from the rooftops and over social media feeds, extolling the spot until it becomes a sensation. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. It’s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!

name: Warm & Welcoming room 3 blocks to PATH train $42
description:
One block around the corner from Van Vorst park, several blocks from Liberty State Park & the Statue of Liberty, 8 blocks from the Hudson River and a great view of NYC.

This cozy private room is on the 3rd floor of a large brownstone. Twin-sized bed. Small desk, piano stool, bookcase, small victorian chest. Large closet. Art on walls. Of course WIFI. Air-conditioner and over head ceiling fan

Shared bath & kitchen.

A 3-block walk to the PATH.

The space
This is a large brownstone row house.

The bedroom is located on the third floor and the shared bathroom is located on the second floor.

The entire house has a wonderful vibe with an eclectic array of furnishing.

Guest access
While the room private, the Bath and Kitchen are SHARED, there is a Washer/Dryer area.

Both the bathroom and kitchen are located on the floor below the room.

House cat on the premises
neighborhood_description:
Downtown Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse community of neighborhoods. Lots of restaurants and drinking establishments and food shops. Citi Bike stands are only a few blocks away in any direction from the house.

With the PATH train only a few blocks away, access into NYC is on a 24/7 basis. Both uptown to 33rd St and downtown to WTC.

On-street parking: No Parking for non-residents from 8:30am to 5pm daily. OK for weekends. Even with a parking permit, parking is very limited. There is alternative street cleaning.

neighborhood_description: Tribeca is an historic NY landmark area that was an early manufacturing district with lovely old, picturesque cobblestone streets with historic architecture and facades restored to their 19th century elegance. Walking along these old charming cobblestone streets is the best way to experience a peek into a bygone era. The nearby lovely Hudson River Park Promenade has seasonal activities such as tennis, bike rentals, batting cages, basketball, beach volleyball, mini golf and miles of pedestrian biking/jogging paths (without cars) that run uptown/down along the river.

description:

This place is 15 minutes from Time Square and 10 minutes from The Sports Stadium's. Look at our travelers reviews for the positive reactions to short travel time to Manhattan. We are 25 minutes closer to Manhattan then the Bronx or Brooklyn. The most amazing amenity this place has is the complete north to south Manhattan Skyline view from our rear deck!!!

The space
This 5 BEDROOM LOFT DUPLEX apartment has two ground floor entrances !!! One step out side the patio door is an amazing deck with complete north to south New York Manhattan skyline view. Please feel free to BBQ and enjoy the site seeing. The apartment consists of the living room & kitchen as a flow thru living.

Up stairs is the NEW master bedroom with a very cozy feel this room can sleep 6 Pepole comfortably !!! Included in the room is one full size Posturepedic bed Q
neighborhood_description:
The Big Apple is right in our backyard! Traveling to Manhattan is only a 15-20min drive or the NJ Transit Bus stop (123 Bus to 42st Manhattan) is 1/2 block away from the apparent. Please ask about our guest recourse documents! There is a ton of info about museums, shopping locations, and site seeing locations! Please don't hesitate to ask for help or any question with travel needs!

There is a community Olympic size swimming pool right next door called Fireman's Memorial Park, including a kids swimming area! Please ask ahead of time if you are planning on going.

There is a 24/7 bakery 1 & 1/2 blocks away between 6th and 7th Street on Palisade Ave. They have delicious pastries, fresh hot bread, croissants, bagels. And some of the basics, milk, butter, soda, juices, eggs.

There's a 24/7 Diner called the Coach House Dinner located on eighth Street and JFK (John F Kennedy) Boulevard.

We also recommend Rumbas restaurant in Jersey City. It

Whether sight-seeing or working in New York, come home to a quiet residential lifestyle on the outskirts of busy Manhattan. Leave the stress behind and indulge in luxurious living without the city noise and congestion! Convenient to all waterfront and rail connections.

The space
Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. Lounge at the resort-style pool, lose your cares at the spa or try a new spirit at the wine room or try out some new dance steps in two chic clubrooms. Run with the family pet at the in-house dog run. Maybe grill at the barbeque. Try a yoga class. Or better yet, unwind in your own sleek, spacious residence filled with state-of-the-art appliances, hardwood floors, quartz counter

name: Cozy bright studio - Soho/Village - 30+Days Only
description:
Small private studio apt. in our family-owned Soho Townhouse.
Close to many lovely cafes, restaurants, shops. Close to all subways. Please read the detailed description so you get a true feel for the place - it is an incredible apartment but not for everyone! Meticulously cleaned and disinfected. We live in the building, so a virus-free environment​ is important to my family. Due to complicated new NYC regulations, we are only permitted to rent for 30+days.

The space
This private studio is in our beautiful SohoTownhouse where we also live.
It is a warm and inviting place, but small, really fit for a single or couple. Beautiful Queen sized bed. The studio has a small kitchenette (no oven) with a small fridge and 2 burners. Also a microwave, toaster and toaster oven. This is the best neighborhood in NYC and living in the studio is being in the heart of it all!

We have excellent wifi and a smart TV and studio is up 2.5 flights of stairs.
neighborhood_description:
This unique location is reminiscent of a tree-lined street in Paris. Cafes, Boutiques, Bakeries, and Al Fresco Restaurants are steps away.

The Subway is 2 blocks away on either side of the apartment that can take you anywhere in the City. Or you can walk, everything you desire are steps away.

Wireless high-speed internet,

ALSO: The house is one of the oldest in lower Manhattan (1835), built on land originally owned by Arron Burr America's 3rd Vice-President (and Alexander Hamilton's great Rival) and the building retains some of its original features and charm. If you love a European/Old-world style this is a great choice for you! It is an amazing house and people love to stay here!

The studio is facing the garden, so mostly quiet.

name: Luxury 2BR Penthouse in the hearth of Soho (Nyc)
description:
Beautiful apt located on the 4th and last floor of a charming townhouse , plunged in the hearth of shopping and night life.
The apartment ,with elevator, has two wide double bedrooms with balcony ,two bathrooms,a fully equipped open plan kitchen and a wide and bright living-room with a double sofa-bed.Tv, a/c, art pieces in each room. The building facade express the history of the neighborhood : it's painted from the bottom to the roof. Art pieces everywhere including the staircases' walls!

The space
The apartment has wide spaces enriched with art pieces . Attention to details and creativity without forgetting high standards of comfort are our priorities. Several furnitures are from Italy as well as linens and art pieces! We were looking for a living space full with art and embedded with Italian details dialoguing with the stunning Soho area.

Guest access
The whole apartment as well as balconies are at your exclusive disposition.

name: Lovely Hoboken Apartment w/Deck, close to NYC!
description:
Located in the heart of Hoboken, minutes from NYC! This spacious 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment located is your perfect east coast getaway! One block away from Hoboken's main drag, Washington street, with endless restaurants, cafes, shops, and bars. Only 15 minutes into NYC using public transportation.

The space
Newly updated and furnished, enjoy our space during your stay! Adorned with brick accents throughout, this flat comfortably accommodates three guests.

The cozy living room is equipped with a new 50 inch flat screen with Fios cable for your viewing pleasure. There is also a futon to comfortably accommodate a third guest.

The cute kitchen is great for whipping up some home cooking meals! There are basic cookware and dishware available for guests.

In the bedroom is a new, comfortable queen bed.

There is one full bathroom to accommodate guests.

Enjoy your morning coffee out on the private back deck befo
neighborhood_description:
Centered in the heart of Hoboken, the "Mile Square City", also the birthplace of Frank Sinatra and baseball! The quintessential, informally sixth borough of New York City, Hoboken is known for it's historic brownstone townhomes, gorgeous views of the Hudson River and New York skyline from the Sinatra drive walking path and being within minutes of New York City. Enjoy the New York amenities without the New York prices!

Start off the day by grabbing some huge bagels at Bagel on the Hudson, only a block away! There are some delicious restaurants walking distance from the home, including Amanda's and The Cuban (arguably the best restaurant in Hoboken!)

See the sights of NYC in minutes from Hoboken, the Path train gets you to the Empire State Building or World Trade Center in less than 20 minutes! Catch the 126 NJ Transit bus to Port Authority which is located in Time Square, usually about 13 minutes.

neighborhood_description: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. neighborhood_description:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

name: Modern 1 Bedroom in Historic Downtown Jersey City
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The upscale, pet-friendly building’s amenities include a 24-hour attended lobby, fitness center with yoga studio, children's playroom, pool with sundeck, billiards room, lounge and more. The surrounding area of downtown Jersey City is vibrant and historic, with plenty of restaurants, museums, shopping and parks waiting to be explored. The PATH train, located mere steps from the apartment building, provides a 10-20 minute ride into Manhattan.

The space
This vibrant one bedroom is located in a luxury building in the lively Grove Street neighborhood of Jersey City. The apartment features Jersey City views, stainless steel kitchen appliances, white matte finish kitchen cabinets, cashmere white countertops, gray subway tile backsplash, LED lighting throughout, hardwood fl
neighborhood_description: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

neighborhood_description: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

neighborhood_description:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

description:
Experience luxury like you never have before in these fantastic Hudson riverfront apartments. Do you fancy a heated outdoor pool and spa with Manhattan views? A modern fitness center, a state-of-the-art theatre room, a clubroom with billiards, and a playroom and playground for the kids? The bathroom is large and is generally your own.

The space

The home is a large loft-like apartment.

neighborhood_description:
Neighborhood is West Soho, a cool area of the City just two blocks from Classic Greenwich Village and two blocks from Tribeca. It's very safe and convenient to everything. My building is filled with artists and families.

It's also right near the Hudson River where you can stroll, bike, or jog. Easy access to subways and buses and surrounded by restaurants, bars, and gyms.

If you'd like to map it out, I live across the street from the Children's Museum of Arts on Charlton Street.

neighborhood_description:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

name: Fabulous Functional Bedroom 30 min to NYC
description:
Bayonne is a very safe & quiet area. Bus to NYC is at corner or train to New York City is a 5-minute walk- to take you to a connecting train into NYC. It takes about 30 minutes to get into World Trade Center. Property is located 2 blocks from large county park with waterfront bicycle routes, tennis courts, supermarkets, banks, restaurants. Area is extremely walk-able.

The space
The space has been newly renovated and is modern, with 2 newly installed windows for a fresh breeze (with blinds for privacy). Also has air conditioning. Bedroom has a high quality firm twin bed, a closet, large amoire dresser, night table, chair, lamp and overhead lighting and hard wood mahogany floors. Space is cozy & clean and perfect for one guest. Fresh linens and towels. Photos don't fully capture the unique beauty of this bedroom. This is for one guest only.

Guest access
Guests will have access to a fully equipped kitchen and bright spacious living room.
neighborhood_description:
Very Safe area. Easily Accessible to New York City. Be careful if your looking in Jersey City, which is a little bit closer to New York City, but many areas are NOT SAFE. Bayonne has an eclectic mix of people, and is a generally quiet neighborhood. Lots of good food nearby: Chinese food, Pizza Masters and Mona Lisa are two of my favorites, Mama Rosa Restaurant is another great cozy restaurant located a few blocks from property.
Quick Check convenience store is 1 block from property, 24 hour 7-11 convenience store is a five- minute walk. Tailor, laundry, a large well stocked supermarket (Shoprite), municipal swimming pool, banks, beauty shop & nail salon, Lowes, Walmart, movie theater, Starbucks and dentists are all in town! Getting around- every thing you might need is within walking distance. Large county park and tennis courts are a few blocks away. If you have a car, you will be provided with a parking pass, and there is adequate street parking near property.

The condo is in a safe neighborhood only 10 min walk from Frank Sinatra Park. You can take a stroll along the water and enjoy the skyline, nearby are all the public transit options that take you into NYC.
The condo is always well kept and has a private guest room available to fit your needs. It comes equipped with a desk, closet and new mattress w/ bedding. Guests will also have access to wifi, washer/dryer and full kitchen.
If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Guest access
Full access to the washer/dryer unit and tv.

Other things to note
Transit options to NYC:

Times Square - 5 min. walk to bus

name: Spacious Studio/Downtown Jersey City/10min to NYC
description:
Studio apartment, 1 bath. 1 queen bed, 1 air mattress, small equipped kitchen, walk to subway (Grove PATH) & 7 min ride to NYC. Rates Vary. Charming and cozy!

The space
Private Entry. The unit is below grade yet has good lighting. The building is a 200 year old brick brownstone style dwelling. The air conditioner is a window unit. This is an urban NYC style apartment and not a fancy hotel or a new construction type of environment. If you are looking for a palace experience, please continue looking for a better fit. The apartment is a cozy, clean, and safe home away from home in mixed community. It is a stone's throw from NYC in a vibrant neighborhood with terrific restaurants. This apartment is a good solution for a couple or a family of 3 looking for peace and quiet after being out all day. Sound travels very easily in older houses. My family and I live in the apartment above the studio so you may hear my son's little feet. We do are best to keep the noise level

The space
One bedroom furnished basement apartment available. It is approximately 550 square feet. There is a private entrance at the back of the house for the basement apartment. We live upstairs in the rest of the house, which is a separate space of its own. Guests have their own area and we have ours.

neighborhood_description:
We live in the Lincoln Park area of Jersey City, in between ST PETER'S UNIVERSITY, And NJCU colleges. We live near West side avenue, and Communipaw avenue.

While in Hudson County, weekly visits to Hoboken are the norm. A cultural Mecca, Hoboken is home to some of the country’s finest restaurants, (Hoboken Menus), bars, art galleries, entertainment venues, and parks.

Lined with acclaimed restaurants, chic bars, and eclectic shops, Washington Street is Hoboken’s main hub of activity. One of Washington Street’s most-renowned hotspots is Maxwell’s, a restaurant/club that offers some of the best music, food, and drinks in the Metropolitan area. For film buffs, the Hoboken International Film Festival is one of many festivals hosted in Hoboken. Whatever your fancy, Hoboken offers countless options for daytime and evening entertainment.

With its proximity and cultural similarity to New York City, Hudson County is sometimes called "New York’s sixth borough". While living in Hudson County, residents experience the best New Jersey has to offer, with the luxury of being only minutes from the city.

description:
Our hip urban home is a great base for your family gatherings or City adventures! Gorgeous chef's kitchen, two 55" TVs with speedy WiFi (Netflix, Hulu, etc). Ideal for groups of 6 to 10 (but sleeps up to 16). Vibrant family-friendly neighborhood, a short 20 min. walk to Journal Square PATH station which has buses & trains to NYC, Hoboken and Newark Airport, all within a 10-25 min subway ride. Our family lives in the downstairs attached home. Ask about add’l bed/bath & rented parking space.

The space
We are a local family, not absentee landlords. We live in the attached home below, but your home will have its own private, locked entry and entirely private spaces.

Built over a century ago, our fully-renovated 3 bedroom/2 bath home includes a well-lit Victorian double salon with high ceilings and a spacious attic bonus room (a great hideaway for kids and teenagers— or couples who want a big bed for each to sleep on) where there are two queen beds, a futo
neighborhood_description:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!

name: Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV, Parking, W/D
description:
Monthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. Located 2 blocks from the light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a driveway for parking, plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, Netflix and WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.

The space
This apartment has been updated to feature a mix of modern design and old-world brick townhouse charm. Everything you need is provided - fresh towels, tissue paper, soaps/shampoo/bodywash, cooking utensils and new appliances. Ground coffee and coffee maker in the kitchen will power your mornings and prepare you for a full day of NYC sightseeing.

Guest access
You may park your vehicle in the gated driveway in front of the house and enjoy a small backyard area in
neighborhood_description:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

name: Garden Studio Minutes to Lower Manhattan
description:
Studio apartment in historic rear building close to 2 ferries and Path train to Manhattan (7 minute walk to the Path, 4 minutes to each of the ferries). Located in a quiet rear building in the historic Paulus Hook neighborhood, this apartment is on the 1st floor (the owners live on the top two floors). The apartment has a full kitchen and wifi, and is entered through a lovely courtyard garden that guests can enjoy in good weather, which has chairs and a picnic table.

The space
The apartment is located in a unique rear building in the middle of a block. It is accessed through the front building, you pass through a hallway and then a garden courtyard to enter the building. The courtyard has a picnic table and chairs to relax when the weather is nice (in the warmer seasons).

Guest access
The apartment has wifi and a bluetooth speaker but no television. Guests can also relax in the courtyard that is right outside the apartment door. In the warm

description:
Flexible Check-In! Check out is 11am, flexible check out available for extra $15/hour till 9pm (based on availability). 10-15 minutes to Manhattan! Luxury building. No gym but we have a rock climbing wall not to far away.
5 minute walk to breath-taking city views and ferry to NYC!
Train station is close by and will take you to 34th Street (Penn station) or the World Trade Center.
Many shops and restaurant within walking distance.

The space
One bedroom apartment (800 square feet), chic decorations, with spacious room, sink bathroom, queen size bed.

Guest access
Entire apartment is available.

name: Huge 25 foot LOFT just $52 only 3 blocks from PATH
description:
A huge spacious loft 20 x 25 ft. King-sized bed, dorm-sized fridge, WIFI, air-conditioner. Flooded with light from 2 Skylights and three windows. Furnishings are an eclectic mix of period pieces. Work Area; Dining Area: oak dining table and chairs. Cozy Sitting Area: futon sofa. Dressers, Clothes cabinet, bookcases. Kitchen and bathroom are shared. The bathroom is located on the second floor and the loft is located at top floor large Row House. We are in a National Historic district.

The space
The LOFT is a very spacious, quiet, light-filled space within a very large row house located downtown on a lovely tree-lined street

Parking is extremely difficult and only available with a permit for locals. However, there are lots of public transportation options: PATH train, light-rail train, local low cost van service.

House cat on premises

Experience luxury like you never have before in these fantastic Hudson riverfront apartments. Do you fancy a heated outdoor pool and spa with Manhattan views? A beautiful private apartment close to NYC in less than 30 minutes, Buses around the corner, located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, near all stores and Restaurants, Kitchen, bathroom tub/shower, Two double bed-size, 12 inches bed/memory foam mattress, recliner chair and comfortable couch in living room

You have full access to the entire apartment during your stay. The entire Apartment is only for the use of our guests not share with anyone else

There is only Street parking available and needs a visitor parking permit that cost $5 daily Monday through Saturday.
Sunday and Holidays is free.
We have USB plugs available

It’s two blocks from the bus stop to NYC public transportation takes you to Port Authority 42nd street Times Square buses runs very often every 5 to 8 minutes which We recommend.
"UBER" is in Jersey YAY!!! ;D download the app and travel around for cheap !

description:
Spacious, fully furnished one bedroom apartment with private entrance located in the Bergen Hill part of Jersey City which is minutes from Manhattan by train, car or ferry. Free parking is available on the street or in driveway (by request) so perfect for families or small groups looking for quality, comfort and convenient access to the city.

The space
This spacious home away from home is conveniently located in the Berry Hill section of Jersey City. The Garfield light rail station is located around the corner making transportation to NYC and other places a breeze and connects to popular destinations such as Liberty State Park, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial etc.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the back yard, as well as parking and laundry upon request.
neighborhood_description: Berry Hill is an up and coming part of Jersey City's Bergen Lafayette area. With Jersey Citys largest municipal park (Berry Lane Park) around the corner with basketball and tennis courts, a doggie park, workout equipment, water park and baseball and football fields the area has a real sense of community. There are also a number of great local restaurants and things to do.

name: Luxurious little getaway
description:
Newly renovated stylish and modern apartment in the heart of Hoboken. The best cafes, bars, restaurants and shops are within a block or walking distance. A five-minute walk to the Hoboken PATH station. Be in NYC in 10-15mins.

Other things to note
The bedroom faces the front street. It is about 11x12 feet in size. The bed is a queen-sized Ashley mattress sofa bed. It is quite comfortable for a sofa bed. The sheets are 100% cotton.
Sometimes you will have the apartment to yourselves, sometimes I will be there, and sometimes you will be sharing the common area (living room, kitchen, and bathroom) with other guests who will be staying in the other room. This is how I am able to keep the price low and affordable in such a desirable and accessible neighborhood. ;)
neighborhood_description: This apartment is located in the best possible spot in Hoboken. You are minutes away from the park, Hudson River waterfront, Path train, and lovely restaurants and cafes.  It combines convenience with quiet. The bedroom has blinds that make the room dark at night. The kitchen has the latest appliances. There's a delicious smoothie shop across the street, pizza shop next door, Italian sandwich shop & deli at the corner, and dance studio up the block. There's something here for everyone.

neighborhood_description:
Bayonne is ranked one of the safest towns in the New York metropolitan area. It is only 10 miles (16 KM) from Downtown Manhattan. Life typically centers around the neighborhood church and ethnic cuisine, and children play in the streets. Feel safe and relaxed during your visit. Access Bayonne is so easy; the NJ Turnpike highway entrance is 1.5 miles away and takes you into Manhattan via Holland Tunnel in no time! Driving would not be necessary since there are THREE Light rail stations in Bayonne!
Our apartment is located next to the busiest street of Bayonne, where you can find two convenient stores, Quick Chek and 7-11, that are open 24 hours, and one supermarket with all you need for a home cook meal, all within a 2-5 minutes walking distance. There are also plenty of restaurants to choose from; the local favorite Mexican/Spanish restaurant “El Aguila Dorada” is right around the corner! Pizza is also Bayonne’s specialty; you won’t regret getting s slice (or two) from La Guardiol

Like the majority of affordable Airbnb listings in Jersey City and Brooklyn, our Tiny House is located in an up and coming neighborhood, further away from the crazy. As it consist of mostly residential houses, it’s quite and friendly. There is a grocery store and a few restaurants a couple of blocks away, and that specific street is in the middle of a gentrification process, but it’s totally safe.
The Lincoln Park around the corner is charming and my personal favorite thing about the neighborhood.
Get away from the busy and noisy Manhattan streets once you’ve enjoyed touristing around and enjoy a walk or morning jog in Lincoln Park! 👟🌳🌸

Street parking is easy to find ( a NYC metro area easy though, please keep that in mind:) )

It takes 25min+ to get to Manhattan, depending on how you decide to get there.

Dharma Home Suites at Novia offers fully furnished apartments to fit the needs of our guests visiting the New York Metro Area and is conveniently located in the vibrant community of Hoboken.

The space
Dharma Home Suites Hoboken at Novia one bedroom apartments offer finished hardwood floors and fully equipped kitchens with dishwasher, oven, stove, microwave, you name it. The large windows allow for natural light and our newest addition to each room is the high tech temperature control Nest system used to heat and cool the rooms.

Guest access
It’s quite obvious that Novia was built with the intention to please. For those who are fitness fanatics, there is an on-site Real Hot Yoga studio. There is a rooftop terrace on the 7th floor that offers spectacular views of Hoboken. Arriving later than planned? Don’t fret, there’s a 24-hour check-in available for your convenience.

Other things to note
NOTICE: The rooftop is not pa
neighborhood_description: Located in the West End of Hoboken, you will find yourself in a unique, vibrant, walkable urban community surrounded by hip restaurants, cool bars, and funky shops. Trendy uptown Hoboken also features panoramic views of Manhattan skyline and Hoboken’s waterfront promenade with walking paths along the Hudson River. There are several entertainment options available nearby Novia. A movie theatre, a beer garden, a yoga studio, Rush Cycling, and many other attractions that are within walking distance of the building. For guests wanting to go to Manhattan for sightseeing or just feeling adventurous, there is a bus that takes you right into Midtown Manhattan in just 15 minutes.

name: Furnished JC 2BR Apt at Metropolitan - Monthly Parking
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
- Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
- Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
- Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood f
neighborhood_description: This luxury community offers all the amenities for the best family vacation; complete with an indoor and outdoor children's play area, a lounge with billiards, theater seating for a movie night, and a health club/fitness studio, the whole family can enjoy a relaxed and fun vacation with amazing views. If the weather is great, head outside to our outdoor pool to include our BBQ/picnic area, you'll feel right at home.

name: Stylish Jersey City Apartment Close to NYC
description:
Cozy apartment steps away from transportation to midtown Manhattan. Close to stores, restaurants and parks in the thriving Jersey City Heights neighborhood. French-speaking hosts.

The space
The apartment has been recently renovated and is very well appointed. It is a garden-level apartment with a lot of light in the front of kitchen/living room.

Guest access
Guests will access the apartment through their own door (at garden level) and will also have access to our Washer and Dryer that are located just outside the unit.

Other things to note
If you are flying into Newark Airport, this is the perfect location as we are about 20 minutes away from the airport with easy and relatively inexpensive transportation options (Taxi and public Transportation). Note that we are a good two hours away from JFK and LaGuardia airports .
neighborhood_description:
The Jersey City Heights area is comprised mostly of two and three family houses, and remains traditionally middle-class. Perched high atop the palisades on the western banks of the Hudson River, the Heights sits 100 feet above sea level and the City of Hoboken. Along the east are Palisade and Ogden Avenues, both of which offer stunning views of the Manhattan skyline especially when standing in Riverview Fisk Park.

"The Heights" is characterized as a traditional and mixed neighborhood community. The Central Avenue shopping district is home to more than 240 storefront businesses. Bordering the North end of the Heights is County owned Washington Park. Pershing Field park is located in the center of this district offering green space, baseball fields, an Olympic size swimming pool and ice skating rink. Adjacent to Pershing Field Park is Reservoir#3 which constitutes one of the largest patches of green space in the Heights.
(Adapted from http://www.jcheights.com/community-a

name: Newly-Renovated, Modern 1BR Apt in Prime Location
description:
Our recently-renovated, modern one-bedroom/one-bathroom apartment is situated in the garden level of a historic 200-year-old row house. The space features an open concept living room and kitchen, washer/dryer, queen bedroom, and full shower. Located on a tree-lined street in downtown Jersey City, the apartment is close to a beautiful park, trendy restaurants and bars, and shops and grocery stores. Paid parking is available nearby, and the PATH train into Manhattan is just a quick walk away!

The space
Our home is a recently renovated two-family historic wood row house. The home is set back from the street about 50 feet. You have a private entrance to the garden level apartment. The bedroom and living space each have individually remote-controlled heating and A/C units, so you have full control of temperature regulation. There is also a washer/dryer in the apartment. The kitchen has a full-sized refrigerator, range, dishwasher, microwave, drip coffee maker, and bas
neighborhood_description: The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in Downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmers market on Wednesdays from May through November. Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away. The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away. There are a number of other restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food). See "Getting around" for transportation specifics.

The townhouse is the perfect place to stay in NYC (especially during COVID) as you can have complete privacy with your own outdoor space. You will not have to share elevators or common spaces with anyone else, as you would otherwise have to do in any NYC apartment building.

The space
-Duplex townhouse
-Beautiful bright apartment during the day
-Sunset view and watch the city light up at night (there are shades in the living room and bedroom, although they are not in the pictures)
-Two bedrooms with queen size beds (each bedroom comfortably sleeps 2 people)
-Two private terraces, accessed directly from the apartment. One balcony overlooking the street with a quintessential NYC view and the other a quieter, enclosed, outdoor space with a BBQ
-3 TVs (in the living room and bedrooms) each with cable and Roku
-Kitchen fully stocked with cooking supplies (toaster
neighborhood_description: This townhouse is right on the border between the West Village and Soho, which are two of the most chic neighborhoods in Manhattan, and perhaps the world. The architecture, people watching, shopping, and restaurants need no introduction. Even if you don't end up staying with me, definitely try and stay somewhere else in this neighborhood for the best experience!

name: 118 Magnolia Ave 1B
description:
Large private room with private bathroom in a quiet, quaint home away from home. Access to a backyard with seating and a small grill if you choose to use it. Free WiFi available and just a 5 minute walk to the Journal square path train. 10 minute ride to the first stop in NYC.

The space
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms. All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, an Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi. We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one blo
neighborhood_description: Magnolia House is just minuets from NYC!! You can take the PATH train to WTC/Financial District/Tribeca, SOHO, Greenwich/ West Village, Meatpacking District (High Line), Chelsea, Flat Iron District, Madison Park, Fashion District & 33rd Street PENN Station.  You can also take the PATH train to explore Jersey City!! We are only two stops from Newport Mall & Exchange Place and not far from Liberty State Park. We are also walking distance to so much in the area! Union Square Farmers Market Outpost, The ART HOUSE, Little India, McGinley Square Shoppes and Grove Street, which has amazing bars and restaurants. The Magnolia House is located in the perfect area for tourists, travelers, students and professionals.

name: Dharma | Hoboken | Homey Studio + Rooftop 🏢
description:
Dharma Home Suites at Novia offers fully furnished apartments to fit the needs of our guests visiting the New York Metro Area and is conveniently located in the vibrant community of Hoboken.

The space
Serving as an alternative to our one bedroom suites, the Studios are a tailor fit for couples and the conscious business traveler tired of the same old 4 star hotels. These cute and well decorated studios display an astonishing sunset view of New Jersey from the floor to ceiling windows.

Guest access
It’s quite obvious that Novia was built with the intention to please. For those who are fitness fanatics, there is an on-site Real Hot Yoga studio. There is a rooftop terrace on the 7th floor that offers spectacular views of Hoboken and Manhattan . Arriving later than planned? Don’t fret, there’s a 24-hour check-in available for your convenience.

Other things to note
NOTICE: The rooftop is not part of the apartment. It's a s
neighborhood_description: Located in the West End of Hoboken, you will find yourself in a unique, vibrant, walkable urban community surrounded by hip restaurants, cool bars, and funky shops. Trendy uptown Hoboken also features panoramic views of Manhattan skyline and Hoboken’s waterfront promenade with walking paths along the Hudson River. There are several entertainment options available nearby Novia. A movie theatre, a beer garden, a yoga studio, Rush Cycling, and many other attractions that are within walking distance of the building. For guests wanting to go to Manhattan for sightseeing or just feeling adventurous, there is a bus that takes you right into Midtown Manhattan in just 15 minutes.

name: Sunny studio in historic townhouse minutes to NYC
description:
Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The location is outstanding! Situated on a sought-after tree-lined residential street, and only a stone’s throw away from all the magic New York City has to offer.

The neighborhood is home to many fine restaurants & coffee shops.
Supermarket 2 blocs away.
Bakery around the corner.
World Trade Center and shopping malls 10min away.
Waterfront with amazing views of lower Manhattan 10min away perfect for jogging & biking.

The space
Private apartment situated on the 2nd floor of our brownstone. You will have access codes to two doors and be able to come and go as you please.

Guest access
Smart home.
Fully connected.
Self check in via smart lock.

neighborhood_description:
Welcome to the Harsimus Cove Historic Preservation Neighborhood in downtown Jersey City!

It's an outstanding location. Situated on a sought-after, tree-lined block of 150-year-old brick townhouses (think: Sesame Street), our home is only a stone's throw away from New York City and all the magic it has to offer.

Yet you may want to linger here, choosing to stroll the pedestrian street along Newark avenue and check out the many fine restaurants & coffee shops.

Key facts:
• Very safe at all hours
• Well-stocked local supermarket 2 blocks away (open till 10 pm nightly)

• Coffee shop around the other corner

• One World Trade Center tower and shopping malls 13min away
• Jersey City waterfront, with some of the most amazing views of lower Manhattan, is a 10min walk

neighborhood_description:
Union City is a vibrant, quite and easy place to be in. There are families, professionals living in the area. The streets are well lit and safe. No high-rise buildings in the area You can walk home at any time of the night and not be bothered.

Union City's early housing stock dates to the mid-19th century, when a group of German printers from New York City built homes in what is now the Union Hill section, stretching from 32nd to 49th Streets. My house is one such house. Soon, the city's basalt bluffs -- part of the Palisades that overlook the Hudson River -- attracted German embroidery manufacturers, which required shallow bedrock as an anchor for their oscillating machinery. By the mid-1920's, the city was known as ''the Embroidery Capital of the World'' and its population of 60,000 made it the nation's most densely populated urban center.

By the early 1960's, manufacturing jobs began moving overseas and Union City slipped into a decline. But it was rescued

neighborhood_description:
The West Village is a labyrinth of shady brownstone-lined streets, hidden gardens, corner shops, and a mix of sophisticated culinary temples and casual down home joints.
I often find myself thinking I feel like I’m on the set of a movie while wandering this charming Manhattan neighborhood. Only, in this corner of New York, I actually often do find myself stumbling onto film sets. In fact, some of the movies and TV shows filmed here have become worldwide cultural phenomena, drawing millions of visitors each year to spots like the Friends building and Carrie’s apartment from Sex & The City.
ake a walking tour to get acquainted with the West Village’s unique history (I recommend one led by Context Travel), including its rich Native American heritage, the impact Dutch settlers had on the neighborhood’s character, and the Bohemian poets and artists who have called it home over the years.

Bleecker Street has always been the Village’s buzzing main street. If you start at

neighborhood_description: This furnished apartment is in the vibrant neighborhood of Tribeca. Quaint cafes and inviting green park space make this a great place to call home. Tribeca is one of the more well-rounded and well-connected neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan. neighborhood_description:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.

name: ⭐Minutes to NYC⭐ Brownstone beauty | FREE PARKING
description:
Urban energy, brownstone charm! Welcome to bustling Journal Square in Jersey City!

We renovated our beautiful 19th century brownstone and installed brand-new everything, from appliances to bathroom fixtures. The front bedroom has a queen bed; the rear smaller bedroom has a double bed that looks out onto our serene backyard. Since we live downstairs we're happy to help make your stay as pleasant as possible. We are fully licensed PERMIT# STR22-028.

The space
COMPLIMENTARY:
-Free parking for one car
-Luggage storage before and after check-in and check-out time
-In addition to cable TV- Netflix included

LOCATION HIGHLIGHTS:
-Train station to NYC is 7 blocks from our house (entrance is on the same street). We are 3 stops from Manhattan. Trains run 24/7 into NYC.
-Grocery store, wine shop, Spanish restaurants, gym/fitness center are on our block.
-Great Italian/pizza parlor, amazing New American restaurant, laundrom
neighborhood_description:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (4,6,8) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

Live like a true Tribeca local for the summer in this 3,600 sq.ft., 4 BR+ TV room loft! Sun blasted south/west exposures (21 windows!), 12-ft ceilings, and beautiful attention to detail throughout. No expense has been spared in decorating for style and comfort. Gourmet grocer on ground floor of building. Close to all subway lines and short distance to famous Tribeca and Soho Restaurants, shopping, Hudson River Park, Nolita, The Oculus, and so much more! Ready for July & August (4 week minimum).

The space
Family home filled with special, loving touches. South & west exposure brings sunlight flooding in at all times of day! TV/media room and kids' playroom. Lots of closet space. Amazing views of lower Manhattan.

Guest access
Entire home is available.

extremely stylish and luxurious 2 bedroom 2 Bathroom . Double height ceilings and elegant apt with modern amenities! you will love this place hands down. message me for particulars

Washington Sq park area and soho ..Location:

This location is one of the most sought out areas in NYC. You are on Houston street which is the dividing line between the the West Village and SoHo.
