name: Charming Old Greenwich Village Duplex
description:
DO NOT REQUEST A BOOKING YET! SCROLL WAY DOWN to the "contact host" button to start our conversation.

Enjoy life as a real New Yorker in our old and unrenovated but homey and light-filled 3-bedroom in the heart of Greenwich Village. Live for a moment in the house where Rose Ingalls Wilder lived during WWI, just steps from Bleecker Street, with a view of the street where Bob Dylan photographed his Freewheelin' album cover.

The space
This is not a renovated apartment! It is really old and has creaky floors and uneven walls and windows that we prop open. It is the apartment of a real New York City family; we offer it for rent when we are going to be out of town, and the price reflects that. (A vacation rental apartment of this size in this neighborhood would normally be double the price.) name: Manhattan Doorstep Retreat
description:
It is extremely easy to get into Manhattan from this apartment. It takes you 4 minutes to walk to the bus stop, the buses run every 5 minutes. Then it takes 11 minutes and you are at the Port Authority Bus terminal at 42nd Street. The only thing separating you from Manhattan is the Hudson River. This is why it’s only 1 bus stop away. When you arrive at the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 42nd Street you are a few minutes walk from the theater district and Times Square.

The space
The apartment comfortably sleeps five guests. The first bedroom has a queen size bed. The second bedroom has a queen size bed and mattress. There is a fold out couch twin bed mattress in the living room. The two bedrooms have doors which lock and have base board heating which works nicely. The living room has a fold out couch with twin mattress. This place has a full kitchen with dishwasher, refrigerator, oven, gas stovetop, microwave, espresso machine, Turkish bath towels, shower, bathroo
neighborhood_description:
Right across the Hudson River sits the beautiful township of Weehawken, NJ. This is a safe community. I live here by choice.
Sleep quietly across the river with incredible access to Manhattan. There is a pharmacy about a 5 minute walk called Walgreens.
3333 Park Ave, Union City, NJ 07087. There is a small bodega down the street about a 2 minute walk.

name: Quiet one bedroom apartment in West Village
description:
Quiet cozy one bedroom apt in the heart of West Village

The space
The apartment faces the inner yard so it’s quiet and calm.

Step outside and you will be in middle of it all - Michelin-rated restaurants, night clubs and bars, luxury shopping, art galleries and historical buildings. Nearest #1 train subway station is 1 block away.

BEDROOM. There’s a queen bed with pillow-top mattress. Put your clothes away in the dresser and hang them in the spacious closet. There’s an iron and a small ironing mat for your needs.

LIVING ROOM. We have flat screen TV with Netflix and Sling TV(“on demand cable”). There’s a sofa that unfolds into a queen size bed.

KITCHENETTE. You’ll find a dishwasher, Bialetti and French press to make coffee, dishes, cups, cutlery, kitchen utensils, pots and pans to comfortably cook for 2-3 hungry people (or 4 medium-hungry elves). There’s no microwave but we have a toaster oven.
neighborhood_description: West Village has it all. Restaurants, jazz clubs, nightlife, boutiques - all just steps away. You might not even want to leave the neighborhood. Walk around on the stone paved streets and discover little shops and tiny local bars, see a majestic sunset on the waterfront. You might even spot a celebrity or see a movie shoot.

description:
Actually an entire apartment listing, NOT a private room.

The space
Actually an entire apartment listing, NOT a private room. Host would not be home and guests would have full and private access to entire apartment (queen bed.)

A true, beautiful pre-war one bedroom without the hassle of walking up endless stairs. Thoughtfully decorated to feel far more like a home but without tons of personal items making you feel like you’re invading anyone’s personal space. Has a very comfortable bed, space for eating and / or working, kitchen with more than enough cookware & electric appliances, a large Smart TV with Apple TV and a couch big enough for two to comfortably Netflix & chill.

neighborhood_description:
Located where Soho meets the West Village, the entire neighborhood is wonderful. Some of the city’s best restaurants, cafes, shops and experiences are a mere minutes away. The Hudson River is 4 blocks away, and has an easily accessible bike / jogging path, as well as parks to sit down and enjoy the sunset.

The entire area has a relaxed, cozy and extremely safe vibe. You’ll easy forget you’re in one of biggest cities in the world, despite being minutes away from all the excitement. Trees line nearly all of the streets. While you’re centrally located to see everything New York has to offer, you probably won’t want to go more than 5 blocks away!

name: Cozy Studio in the Heart of Hoboken.
description:
My studio apartment is in the most desirable area of Hoboken New Jersey. Three blocks down you can take a ferry across the Hudson River or take a bus to the PATH station 10 blocks down anywhere you want to go. Trader Joe’s three blocks down and restaurants galore.. right outside the door! It’s a small studio apartment with a double bed loft with a ladder and an extremely comfortable couch. The movie theater, shopping ice skating rink are all minutes away walk. Twelve foot ceilings make it big.

The space
My studio is on the ground floor in a very safe neighborhood. There are hundreds of bars and restaurants within minutes of walking out the door . The transportation anywhere is unmatched because there is a lightrail, ferry, bus, Path train and a local hop bus that will take you anywhere in the city for free.
neighborhood_description: The neighborhood is mostly brownstones with families in them and hundreds of stores and restaurants walking distance away.  Walk just three blocks to the water and a beautiful view of NYC and tons of waterfront restaurants.

description:
Cozy Private Bedroom 30min by Train to Downtown Manhattan. Clean, modern shared apartment in quiet, convenient neighborhood. Two-minute walk to Hudson-Bergen Light Rail 45th St. station. To get to downtown Manhattan, take Hudson-Bergen Light Rail to Exchange Place (7 stops away, 5 stops if you're on the Express train). Transfer at Exchange Place to PATH train to World Trade Center (1 stop away). Free street parking is NOT available. We only accept guests who are vaccinated for COVID-19.

The space
This unit is a private bedroom in a clean, modern 3-BDRM condo. Comfortable queen size bed with desk and TV monitor. We do not have cable TV, but the monitor has an HDMI cable, so if your computer has an HDMI port, you can hook your computer up to the monitor and watch Netflix or whatever else you normally watch on your computer. You may use the shared kitchen to cook your own meals. You may also use the shared washer/dryer (laundry soap is provided). The apartment is sh

Take a walk along New York's famous High line park, beautifully and organically staged on an old disused railway line reaching up the lower west side of Manhattan. name: The Wanderlust:  Spacious and Minutes to Manhattan
description:
One bedroom apartment with a little deck and backyard. Space to stretch out. Direct bus to the city is just 2 blocks away.

The space
Newly renovated one bedroom apartment, minutes from midtown Manhattan. Here you can live like a local: Drink café con leche at the neighboring Cuban restaurants. Try some Argentine empanadas. Enjoy a refreshing Caribbean smoothie. You’ll get to see the neighborhoods where “real” locals live. This vibrant, largely Latino community is home to some of the most authentic Mexican, Cuban, Dominican, El Salvadorian, and Colombian food around. And the bus takes you directly into the city.

This spacious one bedroom apartment was designed for those who want to be close to the city, but who want style and comfort without paying Manhattan prices. Ideal for explorers, those who want to see the real neighborhoods where locals live. Those with real wanderlust, who want to see something beyond just the touristy places. Also ide
neighborhood_description:
Union City is one of the most densely populated urban areas in the United States. Once known as “Havana on the Hudson,” due to the influx of Cuban immigrants who fled Communist Cuba over the last half century, this vibrant community is now home to a large Latino population. You’ll hear as much Spanish than English spoken, and will find the neighborhood full of Cuban, Dominican, Ecuadorian, Colombian, Mexican, El Salvadorian, Argentine, and Peruvian bakeries and eateries.

There is a Laundromat just a couple of blocks away.

neighborhood_description: We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability.   Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds.  Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals.  Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.    The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few. neighborhood_description: Union City is one of the most densely populated urban areas in the United States.  Once known as “Havana on the Hudson,” due to the influx of Cuban immigrants who fled Communist Cuba over the last half century, this vibrant community is now home to a large Latino population. You’ll hear as much Spanish than English spoken, and will find the neighborhood full of Cuban, Dominican, Ecuadorian, Colombian, Mexican, El Salvadorian, Argentine, and Peruvian bakeries and eateries.

name: Apt 3 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC
description:
You'll be staying on the 3rd floor of a 19th-century townhouse in downtown Jersey City. The house is one block from the Newark Avenue pedestrian plaza, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. There's an ice cream shop (Torico) across the street. It's a five-minute walk to the Grove Street PATH station, where you can get the train to New York City or Hoboken. Door-to-door time to downtown NYC is about 20 minutes.

Jersey City Short-Term Rental Permit #STR21-00073

The space
The house was built in 1887 and is one of five identical houses at this end of the block. It was converted into a 3-family at some point, probably 1970s or 1980s. This apartment is the third (top) floor. The second floor is a separate Airbnb apartment, look for "Apt 2 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC."

Other things to note
Many would-be guests have sent us inquiries, only to have someone else book the dates they wanted before we could even respond. We
neighborhood_description: Our house is right in the middle of downtown Jersey City, one block from the Newark Ave pedestrian plaza, a two-block section of the street that closed to traffic. There are many shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. If you are willing to walk a few more blocks you can reach ShopRite and Newport Mall. Hamilton Park is a 10-minute walk to the north, and to the south is Liberty Park and Liberty Science Center. The neighborhood is safe, and there are usually a lot of people around, so you won’t be alone.

- Renovated kitchen with quartz counter-top, new pots & pans

The space
Living Room/Kitchen

neighborhood_description:
This apartment is located in a residential/ urban area of Jersey City, however given its close proximity to Manhattan it makes it an ideal and economic place to holiday in. The surrounding neighborhood is not great per se, very working class however within 20 min you can be in downtown Jersey City or Manhattan. I would generally suggest taking an Uber in the evening, from the Path Station, which generally costs $10.00
The area is urban and 'up-coming';
Parking: Whilst there is street parking there are times, especially on the weekend that parking can be a bit of a challenge. The apartment is located on a dead-end street, and is in the inner city with many other cars around. During the week it is easy to find parking however on the weekend it can be tight.

name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
description:
Dear Airbnb Searchers,
We offer self check-in. We are double vaccinated but do not require that our guests be.

Activities that are described below reflect times BEFORE the current health concerns. CHECK for openings or closings.

Street parking is available and spaces are relatively easy to find. You need a visitor permit Mon. - Fri. Alternate side parking rules on Monday and Thursday. No permit needed on weekends/holidays. I provide permits for $10/day with advance notice.

The space
I understand that you may have concerns about staying in someone else's home.  I want to assure you that our home will be a safe space for you to enjoy. The 2nd floor bedroom and bathroom are completely private.   They are thoroughly cleaned and disinfected between each visit. Cleaning and disinfectant products will also be available for your use.  
The front entrance is shared by me, my husband, our tenant (who lives on the 3rd
neighborhood_description:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's and Taqueria, three of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, WORD bookstore, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.

Door-to-door time to downtown NYC is about 20 minutes.

Jersey City Short-Term Rental Permit #STR21-00072

The house was built in 1887 and is one of five identical houses at this end of the block. It was converted into a 3-family at some point, probably 1970s or 1980s. This apartment is the second floor. The third floor is a separate Airbnb apartment, look for "Apt 3 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC."

neighborhood_description: Our house is right in the middle of downtown Jersey City, one block from the Newark Ave pedestrian plaza, a two-block section of the street that closed to traffic. name: Peaceful, Modern, Private, Clean Apartment!
description:
Private, modern, clean one-bedroom apartment with private front entrance and access to backyard garden.

The apartment is in a cozy + quiet residential area, with groceries & cafes nearby. Convenient to Manhattan: Journal Square PATH station is a 20 minute walk (or 5 minute bike ride or 10 minute local bus ride) away. The PATH gets you into downtown Manhattan in 11 minutes, to the West Village in 20 minutes, to Midtown in 27 minutes. Street parking is available on a first-come basis.

The space
The apartment is a newly renovated single-floor one-bedroom apartment with new finishes, new appliances, bright lighting and outfitted with modern, new furniture. There is access to the private backyard for some fresh air, cigarette break, or to enjoy a morning coffee while you plan your day. To access the outdoors you must pass through our utility room/shop, where my husband may be working from time to time, and which we ask for guests to be mindful when passin
neighborhood_description:
Around the corner from our home is a fantastic coffee shop, Snapdragon, and across from them is a great bike repair shop. There is a wonderful jazz club (Moore's) up the street. Walking around the adjacent neighborhood you come across gorgeous brick homes built form the 1800's onward. Liberty State Park and Lincoln Park are both nearby for biking, jogging, and relaxing.

Lucky Farmer’s Market has great inexpensive produce so you can prepare meals at home. Exito grocery nearby is an inexpensive shop for produce and other needs. If you have a car, nearby Hoboken has a Trader Joes; there is a Lidl a 10 minute drive south.

Jersey City historic district is one subway stop over (or 5-minute drive or uber/lyft) at the Grove Street stop, and has many fantastic restaurants.

If your goal is to visit NYC, there is abundant public transportation options to get you there quickly. Extremely accessible to Newark Airport as well as major highways to the northeast a

Hard working families with young children live here. Many like next door neighbors have been here for over 50 years. Many are newcomers from other countries including refugees and also from neighboring boroughs like Brooklyn. Everybody is welcome here.

The house is located a short walk to a train connecting to NYC. The house is within walking distance to Liberty State Park which is a 1200 acre park offering dramatic views of Manhattan.

neighborhood_description:
Our property is a 7 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH train station which provides transportation to New York City, Newark Airport, Hoboken, etc. Depending on your destination, it is an approximately 10-20 minutes commute on the PATH train to Manhattan.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

neighborhood_description:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

Jersey City Heights is a residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

name: Bright & open space at the Height of the Heights!
description:
New York City: 25 minute bus ride (bus stop across the street) to Port Authority/Time Square, or via the PATH (15 min bus ride or $7 Uber) to The World Trade Center!
A quiet, safe, open-concept, 2 bedroom apartment in Jersey City Heights. Bright and spacious with abundant natural light. The apartment can accommodate up to 9 guests. Living room converts into a third (walk through) bedroom w/sofa couch, bunk beds (twin&full) in the second bedroom. *More information in OVERVIEW section below*

The space
Hoboken, Downtown Jersey City and The American Dream mall are 5 to 15 minute cab rides away!

A parking is available for very compact cars. There is also an option to get a guest pass for street parking.

Grocery store is a 5 minute walk as well as restaurants, coffee houses and beautiful/scenic parks are nearby in every direction. Great for couples, families + kids, big groups, business travel and short term stay.

The space:
neighborhood_description:
Small town feel in the up and coming Jersey City Heights.

Minutes away, you can walk to Washington Park in Union City. It is a large park with many activities for families or to take a romantic stroll to the cliffs where you can take in the view of the city. 10 minutes from Washington Park you can walk to Hoboken or The River-view Fisk Park where they finished a gazebo which has the most panoramic view of the City you could imagine.

Since I live seconds away from a major boulevard, it is simple to get to the Port Authority/Time Square ($3.75 - Jitney Bus) or World Trade Center! If you do not travel during rush hour, it only takes between 25 to 30 minutes to reach the heart of the city! With rush hour, it only adds an additional 15 minutes tops.

The MTA card you purchase in New York does not work with the buses in New Jersey (different states, so they do not share their money)

I am also steps away from many restaurants, D&D, coffee houses,

neighborhood_description:
Chelsea, just a few blocks uptown from Incentra and widely considered the new heart of gay New York City, enjoys a mix of attractions similar to the Village: shops and restaurants of all kinds; blocks of attractive brownstones and historic institutions; bars, taverns, clubs, and major retail districts. You'll find a liquor store, laundromat, dry cleaner, bike rental, and barber shop all within a few blocks of Incentra.

The Meatpacking District, a 24-hour neighborhood just a few blocks to the West of Incentra, offers trendy new restaurants, cafes, clubs, and art galleries. An area that has retained its character with historic architecture and cobble stone streets, designers, architects and creative industry headquarters have moved in along meatpacking plants, creating a destination known for cutting edge fashion, design, food, and culture.

description:
Classic SoHo loft with giant windows, lots of light, full kitchen and combo washer/dryer in the bathroom.

The space
NOISE WARNING: my upstairs neighbor started renovation and there may be noise between the hours of 9 and 5 on weekdays only.

This is a large loft split into two halves, each with its own entrance and full bath. So you have your own private entrance, your own full bath and kitchen and your private space is over 600 sq feet with a built-in Queen size Murphy bed, a single bed foldout sleeper (both have memory foam mattresses) as well as a queen sized (normal height) air bed. There is a large sectional where you can watch TV - no broadcast service but plenty of streaming options are available to you. Newly renovated kitchen has an induction cooktop, microwave/convection oven, and pretty much everything you’d expect to find in a kitchen in case you want to cook. There is plenty of tea and coffee as well.

neighborhood_description:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

Gorgeous Large BR w/ 2 windows. Private bath outside BR. House has private entry, yard, garden, hi ceilings, CAC, WBFP, W/D, formal DR, large LR.

Kitchen has Miele DW, microwave, stove and refrigerator. I have plenty of cookware you are welcome to use.

I have a cat who will either ignore you or be in your face wanting to be your BFF. Closer to Manhattan than Brooklyn! 20 min to Newark Airport

The space
I work close to home and usually stop home during the day for lunch. Have a cool cat who will either love you or ignore you! This is a very cool, eclectic space with all the modern amenities you could ask for.
neighborhood_description:
My home is close to EVERYTHING! The ORIGINAL Carlo's Bakery from the famed Cake Boss series is just a 5 min walk away as are tons of cool restaurants offering every type of cuisine. Great organic markets just a quick walk from my home for those who want to cook. There's also Soul Cycle, Bliss Spa, Sephora, Anthropologie, Crunch Fitness, Bareburger, Bluestone Lane, Starbucks, Warby Parker, parks and gorgeous waterfront access directly across from Manhattan's west side providing unparalleled views and recreation! 20 min. To Newark airport and easy access to LaGuardia and JFK. VERY easy access to Javits Convention ctr.

This is a very private carriage house that is quiet and off the street and is very unusual for the city. In the warmer months, feel free to chill out in my private yard, use the grill and enjoy some al fresco dining and cocktails! Or order in! Truly a one of a kind.

name: 2, 3 or 4  Floors, Heart of Greenwich Village
description:
Do not submit request! Open a conversation to receive offer based on # of guests, # of floors. I can't offer a short stay until 2-3 weeks ahead so please do not request/inquire for less than 5 nights til then.

Traveling with more than two people? Book 2, 3 or 4 floors of our guesthouse! The parlor is one flight up, the first floor is street level. The "library apartment" is floor three w/2 twin beds, fireplace. 4th floor has 3 bdrms, no kitchen, rented w/the library as "the duplex."

The space
Hello! PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE WRITE TO US AND WAIT TO HEAR BACK BEFORE YOU SUBMIT A FORMAL BOOKING REQUEST; AirB blocks our calendar until we respond, and if we decline. We may have already rented the slot on our own site, or we may have promised it to someone who hasn’t filled out the booking request yet, and if we decline, AirB closes the dates! So please write to us first!

name: AMAZING! West Village Studio+ Apt in Manhattan NYC
description:
UNBELIEVABLE West Village Studio+ Apt w/One Of The Best Locations On AirBnB Available. Has 1 Queen Size Bed & 1 Sleeper Sofa. Full Eat-In Kitchen w/New Appliances: Full Fridge, Toaster, Microwave, Coffee Maker, Cutlery/Pots & Bottle/Wine Opener. Has Tons of Natural Light/Blinds, Separate Changing Area w/Cozy Shower/Sink/Toilet, Drying Area, 2 Closets, Full Mirror & Hairdryer. Has High-Speed WiFi, TV & AC Unit. Right Next To All Shops/Food/Subways. SHUTDOWN SPECIAL: Book Now Before It's Too Late!

The space
Book here and you are in the heart of the one of the most exclusive sections of NYC right in the neighborhood of celebrities Sarah Jessica Parker, Matthew Broderick, Julianne Moore, Meg Ryan, Julia Roberts, Calvin Klein, Liv Tyler, Tiger Woods & The Apartments From Friends & Sex and The City. The area has the most chic high end shops and food at the best restaurants in Manhattan. Laundry is available at a same-day service cleaners located on the street.
neighborhood_description: The best of NYC's nightlife is a couple minute walk down Bleecker St including the Comedy Cellar, LPR, Bitter End, Stonewall Inn & Cafe Wha. Washington Square Park, IFC Theater, Cherry Lane Theater and the Chelsea Market plus exclusive clubs in the Meatpacking District like Marquee, 1OAK, Avenue, Tao and Lavo are close also. The best jazz in the city is at your doorstep at historic places like Village Vanguard, Smalls, 55 Bar, Blue Note, Bar Next Door & Fat Cat. The best brunches, The Whitney Museum, The Highline, Hudson River Park, Pier 45, Mamoun's Falafel's, Waverly Diner and the World Famous Magnolia Bakery are all here. The West Village is a safe, quiet, fun and family friendly section of the best city in the world: New York City.

description:

This is a very relaxed, new, quiet and fresh place you can stay at on a 2nd floor, you have access to Wi-Fi and other amenities included in the apartment, you will have a bedroom with a Queen bed and a closet. Also you can enjoy a cozy area with a reclining couch, kitchen if you need prepare meals and a spacious bathroom with bathtub and hot water.

Guest access
You will share the apartment only with me, you’ll hear me walking around, cooking or taking a shower, but I’ll always try not to be noisy; feel free to cook if you want to use the kitchen, the microwave, the fridge or bathtub (the bathroom is shared), I will always give you the space you need and making your stay as private as possible :)

Other things to note
I have two (2) sweet and lovely cats named Nala and Chewy, if you’re an animal lover you will have a great company during your stay, they like chilling around, they might welcome you as well as soon as you
neighborhood_description: My apartment is located in a good area as you can find access to different transportation, buses to Midtown Manhattan (dropping you off at Port Authority) coming every 15min and you can take them two blocks away from here, on the same street you can take the bus to Hoboken, where you can find the NY waterway (going to Midtown 39th St) or the Path (via Downtown Manhattan) and close by you’ll find the 9th Rail Station which can take you to nearest mall (Newport Mall) and which final stop is Hoboken Terminal.

name: Gorgeous Duplex with parking by JSQ
description:
**Stay with peace of mind - all of our rentals are cleaned before and after each stay by a professional cleaning agency trained in proper disinfection techniques. All our rentals also feature digital locks for easy self check-in**

20 minutes by car to NYC. Situated in a quiet, residential neighborhood, this is the perfect place for your family or group to relax after a long day exploring NYC or Jersey City. There is even a Foosball table for your enjoyment and there's parking for 1 car for your convenience.

- 24/7 guest support via message, email, or phone
- Professionally cleaned
- Self check-in

To abide by all legal requirements and HOA rules, you WILL be asked to provide a copy of your official government-issued photo ID, confirm your contact information, pass through our verification portal and, in some instances, complete a criminal background check. Failure to provide these documents will result in a cancellation and denied entry.
neighborhood_description: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

name: Entire Apt 15 MIN FROM NYC (30 day minimum stay)
description:
A fully equipped apartment located 15 min from NYC. The NJ Transit bus stop is 1 block away which takes you to the heart of Times Square. It's a 5 min drive to Secaucus Junction Train Station and extremely close to Metlife Stadium, Newark Airport, NYC, Expo center. Walmart and Sams club are close by and surrounded with restaurants. There is a lovely plaza center that has a farmers market, CVS, and many more. My place is great for a family trip to NYC or a couple traveling with friends.

The space
My place is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and groups. There is a beautiful park across the street for all to enjoy. My place is great for a busy day in the city and a quiet home to rest in.
neighborhood_description: A nice and quiet neighborhood and the perfect rest stop for a hustle and bustle city like NYC. My favorite breakfast eatery is "Bagel Buffet". It is located in the plaza close by. The park across the street has a baseball field, basketball court, children playground, and an Ice rink in the winter time. Secaucus is just the place to stay when traveling to NYC. We are just across the water so transportation is very simple.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this spacious Financial District furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and beautiful living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Downtown has to offer! (#NYC251)

The space

description:
Spacious & sunny, 1 bedroom apartment located just 1 block from Grove St. Station. Catch 5 min NJ Path train to Downtown Manhattan. Very clean, fully equipped with tons of charm. Perfectly located in the heart of downtown Jersey City! Tons of restaurants, bars, and shops everywhere. Laundromat directly across the street! Perfect location for enjoying NYC and NJ. Tons of sunlight and windows.

The space
Comfortably sleeps two couples or 4 people who don't mind sharing a beds. Full kitchen, wifi, and tons of records for your listening pleasure. There's also a charming little nook which can double as luggage storage or a small office space.
neighborhood_description: Literally, located right in the heart of booming, downtown Jersey City! Quickly becoming the new Brooklyn.  There are too many restaurants, bars, shops, markets, etc. to name.  Literally everything you might need during your stay is within a 3 block radius.  Best of all, you are 1 block away from the Grove St. Path Station that is a 5 min train ride into downtown Manhattan.  Laundry is directly across the street.

name: Sonder at One Platt | Studio Apartment
description:
Set yourself up for success at One Platt. A top choice for a remarkable New York stay. Each space features chic decor, a fully equipped kitchen, and access to the state-of-the-art fitness center. Looking for that iconic New York City skyline? The seasonal rooftop overlooks the city and Brooklyn Bridge. Our expansive lounge, communal kitchen, and co-working space are all yours to enjoy.

One Platt is in the heart of the Financial District. You’ll find Wall Street, The Battery, and plenty of unique retail and dining. And the rest of the city is just a short walk or subway ride away. Visit the World Trade Center and September 11 Museum and Memorial. Explore the East River waterfront, discover the charm of Stone Street, or take a ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Whatever calls you to New York, One Platt puts it all within your reach.

The space
Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

- Con
neighborhood_description: High-rises, cobbled streets, and the New York Stock Exchange. At the southern tip of Manhattan Island, the Financial District is one of the city’s most historic areas. And this neighborhood is more than just a financial hub. Find iconic monuments and stunning mid-century architecture on every block. Catch the ferry from Wall Street for East River views of the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Or to get a taste of local delights, there are sidewalk cafes for cozy coffees and Stone Street dive bars for happy-hour drinks. Whether you’re the Charging Bull or the Fearless Girl — FiDi is for you.

name: Homey Tribeca Studio w/ Pool, Roofdeck, Gym & View by Blueground
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Downtown with this cozy studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Tribeca home with stunning high floor views over the city. (#NYC273)

The space
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your charming living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Tribeca apartment has to offer.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- In-Building Laundry
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Roof Deck
- Garden

- Bike
neighborhood_description: This furnished apartment is in the vibrant neighborhood of Tribeca. Formerly an industrial center, nowadays it is considered an artists' mecca, and one of the most exclusive neighborhoods in the city. The award-winning public and private schools draw families to nest nearby. Locals can be seen strolling along the Hudson River or dining at a wine bar. Quaint cafes and inviting green park space make this a great place to call home. Tribeca is one of the more well-rounded and well-connected neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan. By subway, the Financial District is only 10 minutes away.

name: Quiet, Top Floor Apt in West Village Townhouse
description:
Charming, light-filled Greenwich Village apartment on the top floor of a three family home. Guests enter through a locked garden gate and the back door of the house. Owners live downstairs and are generally available for any apartment questions or advice. In a beautiful, quiet neighborhood with safe and private street access. Serious inquiries only, price is set for monthly stays up to 6 months.

The space
The apartment is a 2 flight walk-up with two queen size beds, a sofa bed and a combo washer-dryer. Huge windows in bedrooms and living room give great light and the bedrooms are on the street side which is a quiet, small street.
The garden is for apartment access only, not for general use. As the apartment is for monthly rental, the layout of the rooms and furniture can be somewhat flexible for stays of three months or more.
A townhouse is the perfect, safe place to stay in NYC during COVID-19 as you will not have to share an elevator. The backdo
neighborhood_description:
The gate to the garden is a few doors down from the historic Cherry Lane Theater on beautiful curving Commerce St. Two doors down on Bedford is the narrowest house in NYC and The Isaacs-Hendricks House on the corner is the oldest house in Greenwich Village, built in 1799.
Tons of great restaurants dot Bedford St. and surrounding area and sushi lovers may want to splurge on/celebrate at Sushi Nakazawa also on Commerce St. (Just make a reservation early!) Plenty of grocery stores nearby, ranging from gourmet and specialty shops to Trader Joe's. Close to the downtown museums and the shopping districts Soho and Meatpacking.

name: Gorgeous Penthouse - Newly Renovated Alcove Studio
description:
I would love to have you stay in my recently renovated charming apartment. Situated in the heart of the West Village, arguably Manhattan’s most famous and beautiful neighborhood, your stay in my apartment will offer you a sense of true New York City living and place you directly in the beating heart of downtown. This is my part-time Manhattan home, so believe me when I say that it is designed to be comfortable and furnished with quality furniture and fixtures.

The space
The apartment, situated on the sun-bathed top floor of the building, is a spacious oversize alcove studio sporting a beautiful foyer, walk-in kitchen, private dressing area and bathroom, and cute bedroom nook. The building has a doorman, an elevator, and washer and dryers available for your use at all hours. The apartment features a large living space, a cozy alcove with a queen bed and a spotless kitchen equipped with a gas oven and range, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, pots, pans and dishware f
neighborhood_description:
As previously mentioned, the apartment is located in the heart of the West Village, also known as the greatest neighborhood in New York! The apartment is located on a quiet tree lined street and is surrounded by world class dining and entertainment offerings. The West Village is the chic, youthful area of Manhattan populated with both high-end and affordable restaurants, trendy cafes, popular bars, hip clubs, world class shopping, and beautiful green spaces. If there’s something you want or need, odds are that the West Village can provide it.

Should you wish to venture beyond the West Village, the apartment is within in walking distance of SoHo, the Meatpacking District, Greenwich Village, Chelsea, TriBeCa, the East Village, the Lower East Side, NoHo, Union Square, China Town, Little Italy, and the spectacular Hudson River Park walkway.

name: Historic Single Family Home near Metro, 2nd Fl
description:
100 year old charming home on a quiet residential street!

Stay in this private space while gearing up for your next family cruise, trip into New York City, epic sports event or your international flight out of Newark Airport! This listing includes one bedroom, one private bath, and one living space. If you have more than 2 guests in your party, please let us know and we'll prepare the second bedroom.

P.S. Talk to us about leaving your vehicle in our secure driveway during your cruise or trip.

The space
This three story naturally well-lit home is situated on a quiet residential street up the block from the light rail. The bedrooms boast comfortable full and queen size beds with high quality sheets and hypoallergenic pillows. The rooms are equipped with a mini fridge, tea kettle, coffee pot, snacks and tea table, perfect for a solo traveler, couple, or family of 4. The bathroom, immediately adjacent to bedroom 2, is fully stocked with organic
neighborhood_description:
What we love about our city is its accessibility and prime location. On either corner of this residential street, you can walk to an authentic pizzeria or ice cream shop. A little closer to midtown you can feast at Cibao for lunch or uptown at Cafe Talya for Mediterranean brekkie. Don't forget to visit the idyllic Magic Fountain or scrumptious Judicke's bakery!

Also within walking distance, two short blocks, to the lightrail that can take you to Liberty State Park (Statue of Liberty), Hoboken (Cake Boss Bakery) or New York City! You are a 5 minute drive to the Walmart, international cruise port; a 15 minute drive to Newark International Airport, Ikea, the Mills at Jersey Gardens Mall, and a 20 minute drive into Lower Manhattan.

name: Comfy & Cozy w/parking easily get around EWR & NYC
description:
Our entire ground level has been newly renovated, 12 foot ceiling, it's including 3 amazing bedroom, and 1 bathroom, back yard full of plants and all kinds of flower, it's located in Bayonne, NJ. this town is like a little peninsula located b/w Staten Island NY and Jersey City NJ. This urban dwelling gives you all of the comforts and conveniences of being in the city. Everything is within walking distance with a short commute to New York City or the Statue of Liberty and Liberty Science center.

The space
this place is the perfect for after a day of sightseeing and shopping! Our place is good for families (with kids), couples and groups. This luxury 3 Bedroom ground floor apartment features WIFI, kitchenware, assential things and everything else you need to enjoy your home away from home.
* 55” Flat screen Smart HD TV/with verizon fios channel
* Modern half Kitchen with Stainless Steel Appliances
* Kitchenware, Pots, Pans, toaster, over the range
neighborhood_description:
very big shopping center is right behind the house, walk along 54th street you will find Twin City Plaza. you will find, Aqui Market, Walgreens Pharmacy, Broadway Dinner, Chandelier Catering, rite aid, Dunkin Donuts, retro Fitness, taco bell, twin city liquor, discount depot, T-Mobile store, popeyes, Hudson Lanes (bowling lanes), Wendy's and laundromat Factory.

Famous Park close by is: Richard A. Rutkowski Park
Famous for beautiful scenery and quiet tranquility.
some historic artifacts and wildlife info throughout the trails as well. Along Bayonne's western river shore this park counting with sport fields, BBQ and picnics area under the canopy, bikes track, wooden walkway over a well maintain natural marsh, with the possibility of wild birds observation, is one of the most attractive place in the city.

description:
The Stonewall Room is our large basement studio and holds two full size beds, private bathroom, and kitchenette with microwave, small refrigerator, and coffee maker. Please note that The Stonewall room is located one floor below ground level, making it the perfect room for sleeping in late. All rooms at Incentra are air-conditioned.

Guest access
Prior to Booking

**PLEASE NOTE**

Due to its historic significance, this house has not been retrofitted to accommodate persons with disabilities under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 ("ADA"), and therefore, does not feature any of the following:

ADA accessible parking spaces;
ADA accessible entrances;
ADA accessible routes from entrances to guest check-in and other essential services;
ADA accessible routes to guest rooms;
ADA accessible common areas;
Doorways that provide at least 32" clear width; 
Other essential features to accommodate
neighborhood_description:
Chelsea, just a few blocks uptown from Incentra and widely considered the new heart of gay New York City, enjoys a mix of attractions similar to the Village: shops and restaurants of all kinds; blocks of attractive brownstones and historic institutions; bars, taverns, clubs, and major retail districts. You'll find a liquor store, laundromat, dry cleaner, bike rental, and barber shop all within a few blocks of Incentra.

The Meatpacking District, a 24-hour neighborhood just a few blocks to the West of Incentra, offers trendy new restaurants, cafes, clubs, and art galleries. An area that has retained its character with historic architecture and cobble stone streets, designers, architects and creative industry headquarters have moved in along meatpacking plants, creating a destination known for cutting edge fashion, design, food, and culture.

My home is comfortable and decorated minimally but tastefully –everything in my apartment has been selected based on quality, design, and would love to share it with you! Located in the epicenter of Chelsea, filled with trendy restaurants, coffee shops, galleries, and boutiques. The location is very convenient with the subway just ½ a block with access to the (L, A, C, E, and F trains). The apartment is turn-key, equipped with everything you need. Just bring your suitcase and a big smile!

The space
My space has a comfortable layout - perfect for couples or working professionals. The studio features a fully equipped kitchen (with all cooking utensils and a 4-range gas stove and oven), dining/workspace, a queen size bed with a great mattress, high-quality linens, and fantastic pillows. The living room has a cozy love seat sofa, 40” smart TV with Roku, and a boom to play music. The apartment features a dedicated work space with a folding wall desk and office chair f
neighborhood_description: Uptown affluence and downtown style come together in Chelsea. Cutting-edge art galleries and gay-friendly bars mingle with sought-after high-rises and converted warehouses in this ultra-fashionable, and ultra busy, neighborhood. Chelsea’s world-class architecture, fine dining establishments, and hip nightlife scene contribute to its first-rate reputation.

name: ☀ Soho: Sunny & Spacious 1BR apt & great view ☀
description:
Soho Manhattan | The most spacious, green and cozy place you'll find! Windows on the three sides with park views on the cutest tree-lined street.

☆ PRIVATE 1BR with a Queen Size bed + Sofa bed in the main living area (listed as room for legal reasons)
☆ High-quality blackout blinds for good sleep
☆ A/C & Heating

1 block from the subway, 5-10 mins to 10+ other subway lines! All the trendy & high-end shops & dining spots NYC can offer YOU @ your doorstep!

Note: It's a walk-up for 4 flights.

The space
The building, like most in historic areas, doesn't have the luxuries of a high-rise - no elevator, and is a walkup up 4 flights of stairs. The space is a one-bedroom, super spacious, like really! With a queen size bed and an extra sleeper sofa in the living area. You'll be able to cook and dine with views of the of the Empire State Building on one side and the World Trade Center on the other! ... Yes!

Guest acces
neighborhood_description:
Soho is really cute - lots of shopping, tree-lined streets. Dominique Ansel Bakery (famous for its cronuts) and Birdbath Bakery are one block away for morning pastries and coffee. One of New York's most famous late night eateries, Blue Ribbon Brasserie, is around the corner, and you have over 10 restaurants within a block.

Designer boutiques, fancy chain stores and high-end art galleries make trendy SoHo a top shopping destination. Known for its elegant cast-iron-facades and cobblestone streets, the neighborhood is also an atmospheric backdrop for fashionable crowds clustering at high-end restaurants and nightlife hotspots. During the day, street vendors sell everything from jewelry to original artwork.

You can also walk to Greenwich Village in 10 minutes - the gorgeous Washington Square Park, and lots of nightlife and dining.

+ + +

description:

The space
"Lovely Tudor town house which had a roster of famous former tenants, including Douglas Fairbanks Jr. and Walt Disney. In 1926, Mabel Normand, a silent film star, dedicated the Greenwich Village building, near Christopher Street by standing on one of its gables and smashing a bottle of Champagne on the new roof"
neighborhood_description: The area's unique combination of low lying buildings providing the best light in the city, charming tree lined cobbled streets with their eclectic mix of apartments, chic townhouses and mega-mansions, a superb mix of retail and restaurants, and it's proximity to the Hudson River Park and Meatpacking District make it the kind of utopian ‘bubble' that seems to be a trend around the globe.

Filled with natural light, this tastefully furnished space features two floors, 4 bedrooms / 2 baths, a fully equipped kitchen, and in-unit washer and dryer. Travel to Manhattan via PATH trains, reachable by Uber or via the Light Rail two blocks away - total trip time will be 30-40 minutes.

Monthly renters welome.

The space
The Alana is a duplex apartment located on the second floor of a two family charming row house in the heart of Jersey City. Groups and families will be comfortable here with enough beds for seven people and two full bathrooms featuring luxurious walk-in showers. neighborhood_description:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

name: Huge 2BR Pre-War Apt w/ High Ceilings on Top Floor
description:
Enjoy easy access to NYC via train, bus, car or ferry. This apartment occupies the entire top floor of a pre-war building featuring high ceilings, large windows, lots of natural light, and charming original details throughout. The bathroom and kitchen have been recently renovated, and the entire apartment is tastefully-appointed with modern designer furnishings. The neighborhood is extremely walkable, with most of what you'll want or need within a couple of blocks.

The space
The building was constructed in 1901. It features the original built-in folding cove shutters; oversized solid mahogany paneled doors and large, elaborately-profiled baseboards and moldings.

This is a "walk up" building and the apartment is on the fourth (top) floor. There is no elevator (typical for these pre-war rowhouses). This means that to access the apartment you'll need to climb three flights of stairs. In my opinion this would likely be the worst part of your entire experie
neighborhood_description: There is a beautiful park one short block away, and another one with views of Manhattan five short blocks away. There are several restaurants, three bars, two convenience stores (one is 24 hrs), two drug stores, two dry cleaners and a new gourmet pizza place all within a one-block radius. There are two supermarkets plus a Trader Joe's within a four-block radius.

name: Chic MicroLoft in the Heart of Chelsea's Art Scene
description:
My adorable micro loft is located in the heart of Chelsea, on 15th St. & 8th Ave, just 1 block from the subway and in the epicenter of everything that Chelsea has to offer- from the high end boutiques to the galleries and hotel roof terraces, to the multitude of gourmet restaurants to the Highline and Chelsea Market, everything is just a few short blocks away. Direct access to Hudson Yards and the rest of Manhattan is right out the front door!

I do not offer tours or discounts!

The space
My micro loft boasts high ceilings, two closets and a full size dresser for your use. The kitchen is fully equipped with a double range, microwave, coffee maker, water boiler, toaster, mini oven, and all cooking utensils for your use. The lofted bedroom is unusually large, with recessed lighting and additional storage.

Guest access
No one other than confirmed guests are allowed at the property without prior approval :)

Other things
neighborhood_description:
Located on 8th Avenue and 15th Street, just a stone's throw from the cobblestone steps of the Meatpacking District, all of the art galleries, the charming eateries of the West Village, and the iconic elevated High Line Park.

Since the mid-1990s, Chelsea has become a center of the New York art world. From 16th Street to 27th Street, between 10th and 11th Avenues, there are more than 350 art galleries that are home to modern art from upcoming artists and respected artists as well. Chelsea is home to the Rubin Museum of Art, with a focus on Himalayan art; the Graffiti Research Lab and New York Live Arts, a producing and presenting organization of dance and other movement-based arts.

Gorgeous, light filled room with a huge walk-in closet for one person. Big bedroom in a shared apartment with 4 other young, clean, professionals. In the fantastic neighborhood of Jersey City Heights. The bus is half a block away. Also cheap Uber ride to Hoboken, with direct PATH train to the city. The room features a Smart TV. Bathrooms are very clean, and WIFI is available throughout. The apartment is equipped with central heating/cooling system.
LONGTERM stay only (over 28 days)

The space
The apartment has 5 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. This is a big room with plenty of space, a huge closet, and a nice desk for working. There's a Roku TV in the room where you can login and watch Netflix, Hulu, etc.

Comfortable full-sized bed with bedding and towels available. All bills included in the price.

Move in and your at home. It's that easy! Laundry machine and dishwasher available for your use.

neighborhood_description: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. name: 1600ft TriBeCa Townhouse | Luxury & Spacious
description:
Are you ready to discover NYC while living like a true local in a safe, luxurious, and spacious home? This 1600ft duplex townhouse is located in the heart of TriBeCa, has two bedrooms (California King Beds) and 1 bathroom. Just a short walk from the Hudson, the 9/11 memorial, and the Brooklyn Bridge.

The townhouse has an open kitchen, AC, washer & dryer, large closets, and comfortable Tempurpedic beds. This is a great place for all those wanting to experience NYC. You'll feel right at home!

The space
[The calendar is updated daily and you can book right away!]

The apartment is available for a discount for healthcare providers, relief workers, and first responders fighting Covid-19. You will have your own private entrance, lots of hand sanitizer and cleaning supplies (bleach, lysol, disinfectants etc.), and your own washer and dryer in-unit. We have implemented extra cleaning and disinfection measures.

We follow Airbnb’s enhanced c
neighborhood_description:
We live in a trendy Tribeca, which is in the lower part of Manhattan. This neighborhood is home to many famous movie stars and celebrities, and is right in the center of all the amazing things that New York has to offer! It's located right off the main road, which makes it extra quiet and cozy.

We live close to most subway lines (1,2,3, A,C,E and 4,5,6), and you can find many cabs and city bikes outside of our apartment. We have a bakery across the street, a Whole Foods, and a Target just a couple of minutes walk away, and many restaurants and bars close by.

If you're staying at our apartment you'll be right next to the water (hello gorgeous views of the Hudson River!), where you can go for a walk or morning jog. We're also within walking distance from Wall Street, World Trade Center, Battery Park, and ferries to Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and the Brooklyn bridge.

name: Spacious & Bright Downtown Jersey City Apartment
description:
Bright, spacious, private one bedroom apartment located in prime historic downtown Jersey City close to all amenities and transportation.
The apartment has one bedroom with a queen size bed, one bathroom with a shower, a small living room with a sofa/daybed, a small kitchenette, dining area with table and chairs and a desk/vanity. Only two short train stops to the World Trade Center station in Manhattan and three blocks away from cafes, bars, markets and beautiful Hamilton Park.

The space
Apartment is accessed through a secure, private entrance/staircase. Please note there is one flight of stairs to enter the apartment. Guests may let themselves in with the key pad provided.

Guest access
Guests have complete private access of this space and will not be sharing a space or interacting with the hosts.

Other things to note

-Wifi
-Iron/Ironing board
-Nest thermostat for heat and Window

name: Lovely room 15 min from Times Square!
description:
Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located home base. There’s no better way to experience the beauty of Hoboken than by sleeping in the heart of it. The apartment is situated right in the middle of all Hoboken’s shops, restaurants, local boutiques, and charming cafes.

Other things to note
CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES
Check-in is at 3pm and check-out is at 10am. While we try to go above and beyond to accommodate our guests, we cannot offer early check-ins or late departures. This is to allow our cleaning crew ample time to make sure your home is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized before and after your stay.

name: TriBeCa Loft - classic open layout, high ceilings
description:
Hi! Thanks for taking a look. This is my home, I live here - except when I'm traveling for work or fun!

So - this is an active, lived in apartment - not an Airbnb quasi hotel. But, I'm very clean, neat, and orderly, so there won't be anything lacking there. Some of my belongings might not all be perfectly put away in order to create a sterile, soulless hotel-like environment, but if you're willing to treat my home like yours, then welcome & I'm excited to share it while I'm away.

The space
If you're looking for a classic downtown Manhattan experience - this is the spot. 1880's factory warehouse converted into artist lofts in the '70s. Open spaces, high ceilings, exposed brick & framework. Large bedroom with queen bed, and bed-like couch in the living room, to sleep up to 3. Open kitchen and separate dining area. Private(ish) building entrance. Quiet block.

Coffee shop & lunch spot downstairs, plenty of high quality restaurants

name: Sonder at One Platt | Superior Studio Apartment
description:
Set yourself up for success at One Platt. A top choice for a remarkable New York stay. Each space features chic decor, a fully equipped kitchen, and access to the state-of-the-art fitness center. Looking for that iconic New York City skyline? The seasonal rooftop overlooks the city and Brooklyn Bridge. Our expansive lounge, communal kitchen, and co-working space are all yours to enjoy.

One Platt is in the heart of the Financial District. You’ll find Wall Street, The Battery, and plenty of unique retail and dining. And the rest of the city is just a short walk or subway ride away. Visit the World Trade Center and September 11 Museum and Memorial. Explore the East River waterfront, discover the charm of Stone Street, or take a ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Whatever calls you to New York, One Platt puts it all within your reach.

The space
Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

- Con
neighborhood_description: High-rises, cobbled streets, and the New York Stock Exchange. At the southern tip of Manhattan Island, the Financial District is one of the city’s most historic areas. And this neighborhood is more than just a financial hub. Find iconic monuments and stunning mid-century architecture on every block. Catch the ferry from Wall Street for East River views of the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Or to get a taste of local delights, there are sidewalk cafes for cozy coffees and Stone Street dive bars for happy-hour drinks. Whether you’re the Charging Bull or the Fearless Girl — FiDi is for you.

The space
The Renovated Downtown Walk-up

Location, location, location! Just across the Hudson River from Manhattan in charming Hoboken, NJ, this historic brick building is tucked away on a cobblestone lane, steps from dining, shopping and nightlife downtown.

There's some interesting history here! This lane originally provided access to the residents' mews, or stables. It was also a film location in the Marlon Brando movie, "On the Waterfront" in 1955,
neighborhood_description:
The neighborhood

Just one-square-mile (2.5 square kilometers) in size, Hoboken is a small town with everything you love about city life. Washington Street is the main thoroughfare, lined with great restaurants, bars bistro-pubs and rooftop bars. Spend an afternoon exploring quaint cobblestone streets, where you’ll find one-of-a-kind boutiques.

Take in the stunning views of NYC as you bike or stroll along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, visiting parks and piers on with way. Join the free yoga class at Pier A or settle in for a movie under the stars at Pier 13 Park. Throughout the year, Hoboken hosts a wide range of concerts and a full schedule of festivals celebrating the arts and food—from Restaurant Week to The Mutz (Mozzarella) Festival. There’s a youthful energy here that’s infectious.

name: Bright, Stylish Garden Apartment minutes to NYC
description:
Welcome to our garden apartment in Jersey City. Perfect for tourists trying to see NYC on a budget or for a longer term sublet, our brand new, one bedroom/ one bath is comfortable, stylish and fully stocked. Located in a safe, quiet residential street, it is a perfect place to relax after a day in the city. Only 3 blocks to the Path train to WTC (in 12 minutes) and Midtown (in 22 minutes) which runs 24/7, making all tourist attractions and shopping very convenient. Groceries, restaurants, etc.

The space
We lovingly renovated our two family home and live upstairs.
We have lived in Jersey City for 20 years and love the community and how convenient it is to NYC. Our family loves to travel and we use Airbnb when we do, so we know what makes a great stay and strive to provide it to our guests.
The apartment has heated floors for those cold wintery months and a brand new air conditioning system that keeps you warm in the winter and cool in the summer
neighborhood_description:
Our street is primarily young families, very quiet and safe, so please no loud parties. It is as close as you can be to the Path into Manhattan (3 blocks) and walking distance to all the amazing restaurants and bars downtown without the noise.
Please ask us about where to go, we are happy to share our insiders' knowledge.

name: Sonder at One Platt | One-Bedroom Apartment w/ Den
description:
Set yourself up for success at One Platt. A top choice for a remarkable New York stay. Each space features chic decor, a fully equipped kitchen, and access to the state-of-the-art fitness center. Looking for that iconic New York City skyline? The seasonal rooftop overlooks the city and Brooklyn Bridge. Our expansive lounge, communal kitchen, and co-working space are all yours to enjoy.

One Platt is in the heart of the Financial District. You’ll find Wall Street, The Battery, and plenty of unique retail and dining. And the rest of the city is just a short walk or subway ride away. Visit the World Trade Center and September 11 Museum and Memorial. Explore the East River waterfront, discover the charm of Stone Street, or take a ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Whatever calls you to New York, One Platt puts it all within your reach.

The space
Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

- Con
neighborhood_description: High-rises, cobbled streets, and the New York Stock Exchange. At the southern tip of Manhattan Island, the Financial District is one of the city’s most historic areas. And this neighborhood is more than just a financial hub. Find iconic monuments and stunning mid-century architecture on every block. Catch the ferry from Wall Street for East River views of the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Or to get a taste of local delights, there are sidewalk cafes for cozy coffees and Stone Street dive bars for happy-hour drinks. Whether you’re the Charging Bull or the Fearless Girl — FiDi is for you.

name: 2 BD 2 BA LUX CONDO Sleeps 8 - SmartHome+ Organic
description:
15 Minutes to NYC and Hoboken

Beautiful luxury condominium with 2 Beds and 2 Baths, patio, and lots of extras. You will have private access to the entire unit for your stay.

SmartHome upgrades - have fun while relaxing at home and speaking directly to your TVs.

Organic, allergy-free and non-toxic upgrades throughout the home, including all linens, washings, & soaps.

All cleaning services are 100% organic and non-toxic - every single linen is clean and fresh for every single stay.

The space
This luxury condominium was once the highest price per square foot in the history of Jersey City Heights.

Highlights:
- Full 4 Zone Audio System - Even Patio
- Gigabit Ethernet for Super Fast Internet Speeds and Unlimited Streaming
- 3 Big-ScreenTVs 1 50", 2 40", and 4K
- All Voice-Controlled with Amazon FireTV Cube for each TV
- Dozens of pre-installed and authenticated entertainment
neighborhood_description:
Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on Palisade Avenue are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses Route 123 which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

A few blocks to Franklin Street and there will be new stairs to the 2nd Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. This makes for a possibly nicer trip, plus the benefits of access to the entire Gold Coast of New

neighborhood_description: Our neighborhood is the most diverse in all of the USA. Great food is just around the corner for tons of options. name: Gaylord Room at Incentra Village Guest House
description:
The Gaylord Room is a studio with one full size bed, private bathroom, microwave, small refrigerator, and coffee maker. The Gaylord room is located on the ground floor, facing front. All rooms at Incentra are air-conditioned.

Guest access
Prior to Booking

**PLEASE NOTE**

Due to its historic significance, this house has not been retrofitted to accommodate persons with disabilities under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 ("ADA"), and therefore, does not feature any of the following:

ADA accessible parking spaces;
ADA accessible entrances;
ADA accessible routes from entrances to guest check-in and other essential services;
ADA accessible routes to guest rooms;
ADA accessible common areas;
Doorways that provide at least 32" clear width; 
Other essential features to accommodate persons with disabilities.
neighborhood_description:
One of our major advantages is our location in the West Village, a pleasant and attractive residential neighborhood and the traditional center of gay life in New York City. With much of the area land-marked for historic preservation, the quaint atmosphere is of the early nineteenth century. neighborhood_description: The West Village, NYC thrives and is one of the most popular nabes to frequent. Whether you’re sifting through the area’s record and vintage stores, grabbing cocktails at a izakaya-themed drinking den with your best chums, or attending an epic drag performance, the Village is jam-packed with historic and new gems. The area’s bohemian population may have dwindled years ago, but a few old landmarks remain. Raise a glass at one of the most legendary bars in NYC, White Horse Tavern, a favorite of such literary luminaries as Ezra Pound, Norman Mailer and Dylan Thomas, or enjoy a jazz set at the legendary Village Vanguard. While the gay scene has largely migrated north, the West Village played a pivotal role in the gay-rights movement, and many shops, bars and restaurants along Christopher Street from Sheridan Square to the Hudson River pier are out, loud and proud, including the historic Stonewall Inn.

description:
Set yourself up for success at One Platt. A top choice for a remarkable New York stay. Each space features chic decor, a fully equipped kitchen, and access to the state-of-the-art fitness center. Looking for that iconic New York City skyline? The seasonal rooftop overlooks the city and Brooklyn Bridge. Our expansive lounge, communal kitchen, and co-working space are all yours to enjoy.

One Platt is in the heart of the Financial District. You’ll find Wall Street, The Battery, and plenty of unique retail and dining. And the rest of the city is just a short walk or subway ride away. Visit the World Trade Center and September 11 Museum and Memorial. Explore the East River waterfront, discover the charm of Stone Street, or take a ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Whatever calls you to New York, One Platt puts it all within your reach.

The space
Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

neighborhood_description: High-rises, cobbled streets, and the New York Stock Exchange. At the southern tip of Manhattan Island, the Financial District is one of the city’s most historic areas. And this neighborhood is more than just a financial hub. Find iconic monuments and stunning mid-century architecture on every block. Catch the ferry from Wall Street for East River views of the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Or to get a taste of local delights, there are sidewalk cafes for cozy coffees and Stone Street dive bars for happy-hour drinks. Whether you’re the Charging Bull or the Fearless Girl — FiDi is for you.

neighborhood_description:
The Heights Section of Jersey City
JCHeights The Heights Section of Jersey City (aka the Jersey City Heights) was once an independent municipality known as Hudson City. Incorporated as a town in 1852, it later merged with Jersey City in 1869. The boundaries of the Heights are Paterson Plank Road on the north; the City of Hoboken on the east; Highway 139 on the south; and the Hackensack River and Pennon Creek on the west. This area (Zip 07307 & partial 07306) has an estimated population of 60,000 people according to data from the U.S. Census 2000.

The Heights area is comprised mostly of two and three family houses, and remains traditionally middle-class. Perched high atop the palisades on the western banks of the Hudson River, the Heights sits 100 feet above sea level and consequently the City of Hoboken. neighborhood_description: The West Village draws fashionable crowds to its designer boutiques and trendy restaurants. Quaint streets, some still cobblestoned, are lined with Federal-style townhouses and dotted with public squares. Notable venues include the Village Vanguard jazz club and the Stonewall Inn bar, site of the 1969 riots that launched the gay rights movement. The historically arty area also has piano bars, cabarets and theaters and central to all the local trains.

name: 116 Magnolia Ave 7A
description:
Private room with double bed and sink in the room located in our Century old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated.

We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.
Shared bathroom in the hallway.
neighborhood_description:
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms.
All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi.
We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one block from 24 hour Journal Square ( JSQ) PATH train station. In the PATH station there is a 24 hour Deli/Café and several Deli, coffee shops and stores within walking distance as well as the local police station.

neighborhood_description: The West Village is easily the most desirable neighborhood in NYC. Home to cobblestone streets, historic brownstones and the best bars and restaurants in the city. The streets are tree-lined and the neighborhood is right off the Hudson River giving you access to beautiful sunsets over the water and miles of trails around the city. Everything you need is only a few blocks away: grocery stores, laundry, public transportation, restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, and so much more. Its the perfect t mix of quiet and quaint but lively, making it the best neighborhood in the city!

neighborhood_description:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Jersey City's Heights section exemplifies convenient, commuter friendly living in a timeless charming neighborhood! Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! name: Sonder at One Platt | One-Bedroom Apartment
description:
Set yourself up for success at One Platt. A top choice for a remarkable New York stay. Each space features chic decor, a fully equipped kitchen, and access to the state-of-the-art fitness center. Looking for that iconic New York City skyline? The seasonal rooftop overlooks the city and Brooklyn Bridge. Our expansive lounge, communal kitchen, and co-working space are all yours to enjoy.

One Platt is in the heart of the Financial District. You’ll find Wall Street, The Battery, and plenty of unique retail and dining. And the rest of the city is just a short walk or subway ride away. Visit the World Trade Center and September 11 Museum and Memorial. Explore the East River waterfront, discover the charm of Stone Street, or take a ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Whatever calls you to New York, One Platt puts it all within your reach.

The space
Working, relaxing, living. Our spaces have all the other essentials you need for your stay.

- Con
neighborhood_description: High-rises, cobbled streets, and the New York Stock Exchange. At the southern tip of Manhattan Island, the Financial District is one of the city’s most historic areas. And this neighborhood is more than just a financial hub. Find iconic monuments and stunning mid-century architecture on every block. Catch the ferry from Wall Street for East River views of the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Or to get a taste of local delights, there are sidewalk cafes for cozy coffees and Stone Street dive bars for happy-hour drinks. Whether you’re the Charging Bull or the Fearless Girl — FiDi is for you.
