name: Sex and the City style West Village 1 bedroom apt
description:
Live your best NYC life a la Carrie Bradshaw in our super cute and peaceful sun filled 1 bedroom apartment, on the top floor of our building with double glazed windows.

Around the corner are the cobblestone streets you see in rom coms with fabulous brunch and retail therapy spots plus subway close by.

This apartment is our home so it truly has all the fixings from fully stocked kitchen to HDTV to washer/dryer. Our favorite feature are our 2 gorgeous cats with whom snuggling is mandatory

The space
The space is genuinely beautiful with flowing, gauzy curtains, designer wallpaper, plants throughout, lush velvet seating and a custom leather headboard in the bedroom - designed to be truly instagrammable.

This is our home so we are looking for a responsible couple who are cat-friendly, and open to a quick phone call with us before we sign over your stay. We are looking for a longer stay which is reflected in the 21 night minimum stay.
neighborhood_description:
The West Village is a destination for shopping, nightlife, and daytime strolls along winding streets. With colonial brownstones, towering trees, and stylish residents, the West Village can sometimes feel like a real-life New York City movie set.

PERFECT FOR
Those who want a neighborhood that’s mellow and laid-back, but never dull.

THE LIFESTYLE
Lazy strolls along the tree-lined streets, stylish cafes, and gastropubs at every criss-crossed corner.

NOT SO GREAT FOR
Renters with time and budget constraints.

THE MARKET
Generally expensive. Low vacancy rates lead to a high demand for inventory.

YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH
The small-town European vibe.

This 2 bed, 1.5 bath renovated apartment with free off-street parking is right across the street from a beautiful park, and in walking distance of multiple buses and trains to get directly into NYC.

Modern space with all natural hardwood floors, plush area rugs, and city-inspired decor. TVs in living room and both bedrooms all have access to Netflix, HBO Max, Disney Plus, Prime Video, and more.

neighborhood_description: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. neighborhood_description:
This property is terrific all year round for a visit to Hoboken. Hoboken, New Jersey, offers stunning views of Manhattan, as well as unique attractions, museums and restaurants. View contemporary art at Barsky Gallery, learn how to make amazing cakes at Carlo's Bakery, go on a food tour or take a kayaking class. Best things to do in Hoboken, NJ with kids include the Hoboken Historical Mu- seum and the Hoboken Farmers' Market.
Barsky Gallery is Hoboken's gallery of contemporary art, representing a mix of young and emerging as well as established artists from all corners of the world.
Established in 1986, the Hoboken Historical Museum is located in what the residents call today The Shipyard, one of the celebrated old buildings on Hoboken's colorful waterfront. The building used to be the machine shop for Bethlehem Steel.

name: Lovely Railroad Style Apt in Jersey City!
description:
This special place is the heart of Jersey City with numerous restaurants, bars and malls around. With a quick 1 minute walk to the PATH train you’ll be two stops away from Lower Manhattans World Trade Center, making it easy to plan your visit to New York City.

Laundry wash and fold just on the building next door and convenience store across the street makes this place the most comfortable and convenient to live in.

The space
It’s a classic Railroad Style Apt. Railroad-style apartments are homes without hallways, where each room opens into the next in single file fashion, almost like a train car.

My apt has two rooms, the last room is my room. My room is closed and has a separate exit and entrance. Meaning I won’t disturb your private room at any moment.

Other things to note
The Apt is on a 4th floor and it’s required to walk up 3 straight staircases.

neighborhood_description:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte

name: Newly renovated condo, minutes to NYC!
description:
Beautifully renovated & modern ground floor apartment in a historic townhouse located in the most famed Van Vorst Park district of Jersey city. Fully stocked kitchen, hotel style amenities and a private outdoor patio!

Minutes walk to the best restaurants, cafes & bars that Jersey City has to offer. Get to Manhattan in under 15 mins (a short walk to Grove St PATH station & two stops to NYC).

Other things to note
Parking:
If you are planning to have a car, street parking is generally available within a couple of blocks. It is free all weekend and weekday nights from 5pm to 8am, and 2 hr parking is free during the day (8am to 5pm). Essentially this means you can park from 3pm to 10am the next day. We have always found a spot within a couple of blocks.

Alternatively, there is a garage nearby, Edison ParkFast, that is around $15/day. It’s about a 6 min walk to our place.
neighborhood_description: The Van Vorst park historic district of Jersey City is safe, family friendly neighborhood with tree lined streets and historic brownstones and the park one block away. The best restaurants and bars Jersey City has to offer are all within several blocks (minutes walk).

description:
Show up and start living from day one in New Jersey with this beautiful one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Hoboken home with stunning views over the city. (#NYC719)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the New Jersey vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman

- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Bik
neighborhood_description: This furnished apartment is located in Hoboken, a quirky historic waterfront community across the Hudson River from Manhattan. This sought-after city is the birthplace of both baseball and legendary crooner Frank Sinatra. Hoboken is an easy commute to New York City, but there's plenty to do right in town. A wide variety of bars, restaurants, and cafes reflects the city's diverse population. There are several notable museums in Hoboken as well as a Shakespeare festival each summer. There's also the lovely Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, which has a riverside promenade with jaw-dropping views of the Manhattan skyline. Hoboken is well connected to Manhattan by ferries, light rail lines, buses and NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Hoboken and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.

name: Zen Energy Home: 4BR/3BA
description:
Known as the birthplace of Frank Sinatra and Baseball, the waterfront city of Hoboken has a charm of its own and it an absolute must visit on your NYC trip! It's also the perfect place for those travel with family and groups and looking for space. Our home offers 4 huge rooms and 3 full baths. One of the room is located on the first floor and the other 3 are on the second floor. We have both front and back yards.

The space

neighborhood_description:
This property is terrific all year round for a visit to Hoboken. Hoboken, New Jersey, offers stunning views of Manhattan, as well as unique attractions, museums and restaurants. View contemporary art at Barsky Gallery, learn how to make amazing cakes at Carlo's Bakery, go on a food tour or take a kayaking class. Best things to do in Hoboken, NJ with kids include the Hoboken Historical Mu- seum and the Hoboken Farmers' Market.
Barsky Gallery is Hoboken's gallery of contemporary art, representing a mix of young and emerging as well as established artists from all corners of the world.
Established in 1986, the Hoboken Historical Museum is located in what the residents call today The Shipyard, one of the celebrated old buildings on Hoboken's colorful waterfront. The building used to be the machine shop for Bethlehem Steel.
Since being featured on TLC’s Cake Boss show, Carlo’s Bakery has become a household name. This venerable bakery and cake shop makes wedding cakes that app

name: ChillHouse Sun Filled 2BR Retreat Minutes to NYC
description: Whether in town to holiday or here for work nearby, this lovely flat welcomes you home in style. With 1200 square feet (112 sq meters) of space, including an upscale kitchen, it is ideal for families and friends or a business travelers remote work location. Exercise in the building's gym or relax in the shared outdoor spaces and roof deck then explore Hoboken neighborhoods with plenty of shopping and dining options. A short walk to public transportation that gets you to NYC within 15 minutes.
neighborhood_description:
Downtown Hoboken houses some of the best the city has to offer. Stroll along the Hudson River on the Waterfront Walkway or take in the breathtaking view of New York City at sunset from Pier C Park. Continue downtown and visit the famous Carlo’s Bakery – You may even be featured on TLC’s hit show Cake Boss. Want to go into Manhattan? No problem! Downtown Hoboken offers ferries that regularly go back and forth. Have quick and easy access to Holland Tunnel, which connects you to Lower Manhattan.

Get in your dose of fresh air at Frank Sinatra Park or let the kids swing at Church Square Park. Grab a cocktail at Zack’s Oak Bar and Restaurant or plan a date night at Grand Vin. With some of the best restaurants in the city located downtown, you will always be able to satisfy your cravings. Choose between a variety of casual and luxury picks scattered throughout Downtown Hoboken and enjoy being in the center of all the city has to offer.

Whether you are in Town for Business, Vacation, Leisure or just visiting family, you have a choice to enjoy everything that Hoboken has to offer.

This newly renovated apartment is perfectly located in bustling Hoboken downtown just a short walking distance to Washington street with many restaurants, bars, shopping, a short distance from Hoboken's renowned waterfront and Frank Sinatra park with spectacular NYC views, and 10 min walking distance from Stevens College and the path train to NYC.

The space
Completely renovated cozy 1 bedroom apartment in a great location just 7 min walk to the path train and a block away from a huge selection of restaurants, bars, shopping.

Hardwood floor throughout the apartment

Bedroom
- Queen sized bed
- Smart TV
- Dresser

Kitchen:

- Fully stacked kitchen, with everything you need to cook
- Pots/Pans
- Serving utensils

Guest access<
neighborhood_description:
Hoboken is a New Jersey city on the Hudson River. Its former industrial port now features parks such as Pier A Park, with Manhattan skyline views.

The Hudson River Waterfront Walkway links several green spaces. Global eateries, bistros and bars cluster on Washington Street and Riverside Frank Sinatra Drive, named after the locally born singer.

The Hoboken Historical Museum has local art and history exhibits.

name: Private 1 bedroom right near NYU and Wash. Sq Park
description:
Private & eclectic one bedroom apartment. This unit offers a full kitchen, dining area (seats 6) & separate living room.
The bedroom has a queen size bed, vanity and dresser for your use. There’s also a closet for hanging items in the living room for your use.
Each window has a screen, rare for New York! Two AC units keep the entire unit nice & cool.
Location is key: walking distance to NYU and Washington sq park.
Very near to almost every subway line.
Located on the second floor of a walk up.

Guest access
Full apartment: kitchen, dining room, bathroom, living room, and bedroom. There is also a great fire escape “balcony” for smoking or enjoying some sunshine.

Other things to note
Extras: set of dominoes, full deck of cards, nice Bluetooth soundbar.
Available on tv: Apple TV, Netflix, HBO max, peacock, Amazon, Hulu.
neighborhood_description: In the heart of the West Village just steps away from Stonewall and Washington Square Park. This apartment is located between two bar/restaurants at each end of the street. Because of this, the street closes to thru traffic from 5-10pm every day for the NYC Open Restaurants program. Open Restaurants began as a Covid strategy to help restaurants improve business with more outdoor seating. It was such a success that it’s now become a steadfast tradition. It also makes this exact location hard to beat! The street is quiet with absolutely no traffic/noise from traffic, yet after just 100 steps in any direction and you’ll wind up in a beautiful and lively hub. Anything you could ever need is within two blocks! It’s amazing.

description: Enjoy a stylish experience at this newly renovated modern duplex with 3 beds and 2 baths with chic decor. The house is located 5 mins walking to the light rail which will take you into NYC in 15 mins. The neighborhood is perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike.  Jersey City has a vibrant food scene and was name America's next great food city by Travel and Leisure
neighborhood_description: 5 mins from NYC Jersey City has a vibrant food scene and was named America's next great food city by Travel and Leisure. Pop into any of the many corner bars throughout this neighborhood. Each bar has a slightly different flavor (though most promise at least a beer and a bite to eat!) and every local swears loyalty to “their” beloved bar. Rising above Jersey City, the Heights boast truly spectacular views of the Manhattan skyline. As the sun sets on Riverview Fisk Park, unobstructed views allow you to take in the full splendor of the city’s lights. The Heights additionally boasts its own lush green fields in Pershing Field Park, aquatic diversions at the Reservoir, fresh adventures through the Riverview Farmers Market or strolls through the Riverview Arts District.

name: ChillHouse Sunny 2BR Flat Roof Deck mins to NYC
description: Whether in town to holiday or here for work nearby, this lovely flat welcomes you home in style. With 1200 square feet (112 sq meters) of space, including an upscale kitchen, it is ideal for families and friends or a business travelers remote work location. Exercise in the building's gym or relax in the shared outdoor spaces and roof deck then explore Hoboken neighborhoods with plenty of shopping and dining options. A short walk to public transportation that gets you to NYC within 15 minutes.
neighborhood_description:
Downtown Hoboken houses some of the best the city has to offer. Stroll along the Hudson River on the Waterfront Walkway or take in the breathtaking view of New York City at sunset from Pier C Park. Continue downtown and visit the famous Carlo’s Bakery – You may even be featured on TLC’s hit show Cake Boss. Want to go into Manhattan? No problem! Downtown Hoboken offers ferries that regularly go back and forth. Have quick and easy access to Holland Tunnel, which connects you to Lower Manhattan.

Get in your dose of fresh air at Frank Sinatra Park or let the kids swing at Church Square Park. Grab a cocktail at Zack’s Oak Bar and Restaurant or plan a date night at Grand Vin. With some of the best restaurants in the city located downtown, you will always be able to satisfy your cravings. Choose between a variety of casual and luxury picks scattered throughout Downtown Hoboken and enjoy being in the center of all the city has to offer.
